Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janet S
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7 found this hotel to be perfectly located. The clean rooms , kind helpful staff and the great price make this a great choice. A European breakfast with plenty of choices was a terrific start to our day. We,d stay again. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “nice and relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: cosmoPD
Reviews.Content: it's a tiny place very close to "Punta della Salute". Perfect for a central place in a relaxing area of Venice. Room was wonderful and new, breakfast wasn't particularly various but good enough. You can go with your pet. Owners are very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, helpful reception - good value.”
Reviews.Author: MisterJohnH
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the airport, bus to venice, vaparretto to salute, over 1st little bridge on right, straight ahead thru square, straight on, Hotel on left before next bridge. Comfortable, friendly, clean, breakfast is Italian - they take an double-expresso and fly to work - so don't expect a massive plateful or a fry up. You'll be out for a great lunch later anyway. Prosecco or house white both brilliant, go for a walk, get lost - everyone does. St Mark's is one stop away. Enjoy this beautiful city, we did!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Clean, Quiet, Lovely Owners”
Reviews.Author: maxjeffjen1
Reviews.Content: Valentina and Graziella made my stay SO lovely after having my wallet stolen in a Sheraton in Padova! They accepted my new credit card number with no trouble at all (I was so worried about not having the physical card!) but they were most accommodating. The hotel is clean, charming, has spacious rooms, and my bathroom (in room #12) was new!! Brilliantly clean white tiles. I was surprised at how spacious the entire room was, and the staff was so friendly and nice. The breakfast is good, and someone is even there to make your coffee! The price of my stay was ridiculously modest, and the location was fabulous--SO close to San Marco, but not on a highly trafficked street, ensuring a quiet night's sleep. I loved it, I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect "A+": Hotel, Staff, Location”
Reviews.Author: Susana007
Reviews.Content: "He who never leave his own country is full of prejudices" - Carlo Goldoni (1707-1798) I believe it is easy to travel, but difficult to be a "good" traveler. I have stayed at the Locanda Ca'Zose 5 times including July and August of 2011 with different family members (husband, niece, sister and family). Perhaps this review will assist in illustrating why I will continue to come back again and again. The Hotel: A small, comfortable family-owned hotel in a 17th C. building in the Dorsoduro neighborhood, the rooms are charmingly Venetian in style - clean, maintained, comfortable beds, efficient airconditioning, pretty bathrooms, a safe and a television which could benefit from a channel selection guide and user directions. Regarding the three room in which I have stayed: one overlooked a courtyard and roofs, one had 17 century beams, and the other had a beautiful view of the small bridge and canal near the hotel. The breakfast room is small and intimate with an excellent selection of Continental breakfast items to get a visitor going in the morning: cappuccino/coffee/tea/water/juices/milk and cereal/granola, yogurts, hard-boiled eggs, bread for toast, pasteries, cheese and jams. The Staff: The sisters, Graziella and Valentina assist their guests in making their stay at the hotel and Venice pleasant; helping with questions about transportation, connections, event venues, and other things of interest. The 24 hour front desk staff speaks English and perhaps other languages of which I am not aware. Suggestion: it is best not to wait until the very last minute to inquire about the bill, since some staff members may need to refer you to one of the sisters who may not be present at that time. The Location: Dorsoduro! A true neighborhood! Walk 5 minutes, just 3 blocks to the vaparetto stop Santa Maria della Salute (water bus with connections to San Marco, the islands of Lido, Murano, Buranoand towards the Rialto bridge and market, the train station and Piazzale Roma area); walk 3 minutes, 1/4 block to the traghetto (gondola crossing the Grand Canal for a small fee), walk 5 minutes to the P. Guggenheim Collection, 10 minutes to Accademia and bridge; walk 15 minutes to Campo San Barnaba to an interesting display of Leonardo da Vinci inventions, and there are many excellent restaurants and shops. Note: I recommend the plastic-coated map Streetwise Venice (online and bookstores) - I also use Artwise Venice, Streetwise and Artwise Rome, Streetwise and Artwise Florence, Streetwise Milan, Streetwise Naples and Vicinity. I can actually say that I have never been lost in Venice (but I have never been there in fog - just clear weather) thanks to that map. I hope this has helped and good traveling...Susana

Reviews.Title: “5 very good days and nights in Locanda Ca' Zose, Venezia”
Reviews.Author: steenkrarup
Reviews.Content: From 10th to 15th of November 2011, both days included, I stayed in Locanda Ca' Zose, Venezia, with my friends Richard Page Leroy-Cruce, Lisbeth Ryge and Ole Schjoerer. We were very satisfied with the Hotel, It's staff, who were very friendly and kind people, our rooms with bath and toilets were in good shape and clean, the morning meal included in the price was very varied among the items you could drink and eat, and thus the hotel's central situation close to the vaporetto-station Salute. A perfect holiday we spent there. Recommendable. We'll go there next time. Written by Steen Krarup, Copenhagen, Denmark.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: minou-grou-grou
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, spacious room, spacious bathroom, very quiet at night, close to vaporetto stop "Salute", nice area. Breakfast room is very small, might be crowded at times. Breakfast is not fantastic but OK for Italian standards. We paid ca. 90 euro (advance payment rate) for the room per night and this is quite good value for Venice. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: littleshirin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in December 2011. It's a lovely little place, 1 minute away from the wonderful Salute, the vaporetto stop & the Peggy Guggenheim Museum. I stayed in the blue room (ask for room #20) and loved it. The room seems much bigger in photos (everyone loves a wide-angle lens) but the room was equally beautiful & quite cute nonetheless. The bed was comfortable and the windows are sound proof - even with men working on a building next door. Friendly reception staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Desk People!”
Reviews.Author: Christina T
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking, so we were a little nervous about what we were getting. Maddison was our check-in person and he was friendly, spoke great English (as did nearly all the staff) and was very accommodating, even at 1 in the morning! He gave us maps and good restaurant suggestions. The hotel itself is near 3 aquabus stations: Salute, Zattere and I don't recall the 3rd. It is also very near to the beautiful Santa Maria del Salute. Breakfast was great with a helpful little lady making capuccinos and a big stack of Venice tourism books. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Low expectations met...not sure why this place has so many positive reviews.”
Reviews.Author: jmd437
Reviews.Content: The location is by far the best part. Beds are very uncomfortable, room was stuffy and slightly smelly, carpets dirty & staff unfriendly. Also, they keep a door open on the 1st floor to the outside so tons of mosquitos were in our rooms. The price wasn't bad but it's still not worth the lack of sleep from itchy, uncomfortable bed & pillows. Also, the tv doesn't work in the room. Asked the staff for some recommendations for food/dinner in the area & they weren't helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: val_Cheshire_England
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to Venice previously, were a little unsure of the location / Dorsoduro area, but no need. We caught the vaporetti from the railway station down the Grand Canal to Salute, we then had less than a 5 minute walk over one small bridge to the hotel. Our bedroom and bathroom were both a good size and very clean, all staff extremely helpful, especially the two sisters who own the hotel. There was a good selection for breakfast (continental) , some reviews have criticized the size of the breakfast room, although small, we stayed here for 7 nights, and there was a free table every morning as soon as we arrived for breakfast. Dorsoduro has a lovely selection of restaurants, there are also excellent bars and restaurants in other areas within easy walking distance or a short trip on the vaporetti. San Marco and the Lido are both easily accessible from Salute.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: pwjohns
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. A quiet location, yet only minutes from San Marco. We paid 160EU per night for the room including breakfast. A real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Locanda Ca Zose”
Reviews.Author: merryprowler
Reviews.Content: Very nice, small hotel in a great, picturesque location, just off the Grand Canal in Dorsoduro. Very near the Salute church and vaporetto stop, the Peggy Guggenheim Museum, and the Academia. Lots of boutiques, shopping, art galleries, bars, and restaurants nearby, Away from the noise of the congested San Marco area, but right across the canal by vaporetto. Our room and bathroom were of good size. Breakfast was very good, and the management was great. The hotel has no lift, so we had to drag our suitcases up and down two flights of stairs upon arrival and departure. They also charge for WiFi, which many hotels offer for free. Overall, though, a great value and wonderful, charming place to stay. We heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good place!”
Reviews.Author: DonchPDX
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose the Ca' Zose from among the many places to stay in Venice. In part, it had a room available when we wanted, and it also sounded well-located. There were many positive reviews on it, too. We arrived there in late May, 2011, in the shoulder-season when the whole world descends on Venice to enjoy the weather. I can see why. It was very lovely, with sunny days, early morning drifting clouds, a gentle breeze, and warm for walking around and when standing in the sun. Ca' Zose is a small place. When we first arrived late in the evening after driving all day from Munich, as we got off the Vaporetto at Salute' stop, it was an act of faith to start dragging our luggage through the narrow (did I say narrow?) walkways between buildings and hope we would pop out of the maze at the front door of our hotel. It turned out to be very direct and easy to find, although we walked by it the first time. The address numbering system is not clear. Check-in was easy and the staff person spoke enough English to make us feel welcome and understood. We had called ahead while still driving to Venice because road construction from Munich had eaten up several hours and we were worried our room might be let go. The host assured us they were expecting us and not to worry. Our room was on the 2nd or 3rd floor, up a narrow, steep, and winding stairway. When we opened our room door, we weren't sure what we had gotten into. It was quite a small room, and the view out the windows was the window shutters of the building across the walkway we had just been on. Happily our windows also had outside shutters that allowed airflow, eliminated light, and minimized sounds from people walking down below. We discovered that it is an out-of-the-way location and foot-traffic, hence noise, was never a problem for us. The room turned out to be quite comfortable. No internet of any kind in the room, but available via wifi in the lobby for a fee. The place was clean, nicely appointed although a bit funky. Tap water is drinkable and Venetians are quite proud of the "Mayor's Water", which comes via pipe from the mainland down from the Alps. Breakfast was a nice surprise and we felt it gave us a good start on the day. We discovered the Peggy Guggenheim art museum about 5 minutes walking distance. It is a must see and gives a tremendous appreciation of her influence in the world of art and of her love for this jewel of a city. There are numerous restaurants and bars within easy walking distance, without having to resort to water buses or bridge-crossings. We found this hotel to be nicely situated for everything we wanted to do and see. The last day we splurged for a gondola ride (100 euros!! Beware, the prices go up into the evening) and were delivered to a dock close to the Ca' Zose. Overall, we wouldn't hesitate to go back to the Ca' Zose. When we checked out, the person at the desk was one of the sister-owners. She told us the history of the hotel and their hopes and dreams for the place. I'd say they have done a lovely job of making a small, boutique hotel in a quiet location, yet well placed for easy access (although, in a city the size of Venice, no place is very far away anyway!) As an after-comment, my wife had gotten sick in Greece just prior to coming to Italy. We had to extract a day from the Italian portion of our trip and chose to take it from the Florence part, not Venice. The hotel easily managed our adding that day while subtracting one from the front end of the visit at no charge. We were so happy to have had our full stay in Venice and enjoyed it so much more than Florence. Venice is a priceless gem, and this hotel is worth considering if you want something nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest you aching bones in Venice”
Reviews.Author: OLDGOAT67
Reviews.Content: A great place to rest aching legs. Very clean... comfortable large airconditioned room. Breakfast sets you up for the day. Its in one of the best locations in Venice The owners.. two lovely ladies are so friendly always happy to give the best advice on where to go where to eat and make all the arrangement if needed. Only thing missing is a place to sit and relax and have a drink away from the huge crowds

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: sarah2457
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations, the photographs don't do it justice. It was fresh, charming, clean, spacious and the staff are very friendly. The breakfast was basic but overall the hotel presented excellent value for money. We had trouble finding the hotel and the water buses were on strike so it was a bit of a hike but it is well located for the Peggy Guggenheim Museum and a number of smaller shops.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem- we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: verdi2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the hotel many times and would always award top marks. It is away from the crowds, in a very beautiful part of Venice but still only one vaporetto stop from St Marks Square. Every room that we have stayed in has been first class and absolutely spotless, with all that we could wish for. It is owned by two delightful and charming sisters who readily offer help and advice to make your stay in Venice even more perfect and we have found all the staff extremely friendly. We will be returning in a few weeks, knowing that we will be staying in the best locanda in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel. We won't stay here next time.”
Reviews.Author: LibbyWestmoreland
Reviews.Content: After reading the initial reviews we thought we had made a good decision, and in part, we did. The location of the hotel is prime. It is in a very quiet area very near the Peggy Guggenheim museum. There are plenty of shops and quaint restaurants in the area as well. The hotel is very pretty. When we arrived our room was not ready. They told us it was ready, but when we entered, it had empty, unwashed glasses from the previous guests and a few other items that needed tending. Later we found trash cans that were not emptied either. But the room was rather nice, small, but that's expected in Italy. My husband decided to take a quick shower while I repacked our suitcases to make room for more souvenirs. I finished and grabbed a book and nestled onto the bed to read. The room was very hot and stuffy. The fan in the room didn't do much to help out, but it was all we had so we spent as much time as possible in the city, and that's what you do when you're in Venice. My husband stood in the bathroom door and asked me what happened to my feet. I looked at the bottom of my white socks and found them covered in dirt and dust. He made me bring him his shoes before he would leave the bathroom. The rug in our room was a mess. It hadn't been properly cleaned in forever, so we spent our time in our room with our shoes on so as not to let our feet touch the floor. I didn't see any mold in the shower, but then again I really didn't look for it. I wouldn't stay here again, because of the dirty carpet which had hair, dust balls in the corners and even a few bugs. My husband was brave enough to look under the bed, but I told him, not to tell me anything, just get in the bed. Soap and water and a good vacuum cleaner are cheap and easy to use. Dirt, dust, hair and bugs on the carpet in a hotel is inexcusable. A hotel cannot be unclean or you won't keep guests coming back. No problems with staff, but they did seem happy in the mornings. We didn't eat breakfast there, so I cannot comment on the food, but I didn't want to eat there because of the condition of the room. We only stayed two nights, but that was enough. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will come back!”
Reviews.Author: MVC78
Reviews.Content: Location: Very convenient, close (walking distance) to San Marco Square, and 200 mts from vaporetto stop, Salute Room: Very spacious room, nice decoration, very comfortable. Super clean Breakfast: Continental breakfast, lot of variety. Attention: All people involved were lovely, polite and very nice when asking about indications and recommendations. 100% recommendable

Reviews.Title: “Memorable...”
Reviews.Author: FilipeSerrano
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Venice, you're going the place a bookmark in your life. It's the most beautiful city in the world. I can't find the words to describe what the 4 days i've spend there were. The hotel Locanda Ca'Zose is a small hotel in the southern area of Venice. The location is good but not central so everyday you have a walk to and from the hotel. But i believe that it's worth it, becau the city is so beautiful that you'll fall in love with these walks every day. They'll become a simple pleasure. The hotel itself is good. Everything was clean and taken care of (apparently), the breakfast was good and everybody is very kind and polite. For a medium price range you can count on this one. It's not luxurious, but very confortable. I liked it and i may consider it for the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for the price.”
Reviews.Author: hankes07
Reviews.Content: Nothing to write home about, but it was a decent room for the price. Clean, comfortable, the breakfast was so so. Off the beaten path, which could be a good or bad thing depending on your preference.

Reviews.Title: “Best place we stayed during our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Jraby2008
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! The staff was friendly, welcoming, and helpful. The rooms were spotless and the beds were very comfortable. The staff made it clear that they would get us anything we needed. The breakfast was wonderful and generous (the coffee service was excellent). The location is away from the loud crowds, but still walkable from Piazza San Marco. This is the best sleep I had in Italy. It was amazing to come back to our comfortable, cool room after a long, hot day of walking. And the mini bar was shockingly inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great price - for Venice!”
Reviews.Author: FairAir
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days and couldn't have chosen a better location - away from usual sites so few tourists yet close to everything. The rooms had character, which is rare for "cheaper" hotels (in the Venice sense of cheap!) and personnel will helpful and friendly. The only negative we could think of was the steep and narroy stairs to the rooms, which could be a problem for those with large cases, and the breakfast room which was small. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay there.Ask

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED Locanda Ca Zose and hope to go back again!”
Reviews.Author: Tomaskova
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Laconda Ca Zose for two nights in room 10. It was beautiful. We were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary and they suprised us with a bottle of champagne. The hotel was easy to find based on the directions we were emailed, and was in a great central location for the water bus, and to the main square. Breakfast was great, the service was wonderful. I would reccomend this location to anyone looking to experience the decor and charm of Venice at a very reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: BrightonFriend
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the great deal we were offered by booking direct and after reading previous tripadvisor reviews. It's in a great location on a very pretty canal only 2 minutes from the Salute vaporetto stop (view of Salute from our window), a short hop across the Grand Canal to St Mark's, or easy walking distance to the Accademia stop and the Zattere. We chose to catch the vaporetto to Ca'Rezonnica/S. Toma to the Campo San Barnaba area (we liked restaurant Al Casin dei Nobili) to eat most evenings then walk back at a leisurely pace after our meal. The hotel itself was faultlessly clean and there was plenty of space in our 'superior' room with 4 double windows opening onto the street below. Area very quiet at night and no noise from day-time passers by penetrated once windows closed. Good, effective, quiet air-conditioning. Only gripes: fan in bathroom not working, no soap dish in shower, and we could hear next door's shower, etc. (but no voices). We found the bed comfortable and were offered extra pillows which we accepted. Breakfast was fine - typical European with meat and cheeses as well as various cakes, breads, jams, and hard boiled eggs. Someone was constantly on hand to make fresh individual cappuccinos, lattes, tea, etc., as desired. We found all the hotel staff very friendly and helpful and did not regret our choice once.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel in a quieter neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Gat821
Reviews.Content: With this hotel being in the Dorsoduro area, you get away a bit from the more crowded areas in San Marco, a good thing in our book. The traghetto to cross the Grand Canal is just down the corner, so it's very easy to get to San Marco. The Peggy Guggenheim museum is about an 10 minute walk, the Santa Maria Della Salute church a 5 minute walk. This hotel is just in a great location. Rooms are small by American standards, but probably typical for European standards. They're decently clean, breakfast has breads, meats, fresh fruit, and good cappuccino. You get wireless Internet access only in the small lobby however. It would be nice to have this in the rooms as well. Still, a good, decent place to stay in a less crowded area in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and nice location”
Reviews.Author: delta004
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in Dorsoduro, which is just a bit further away from the very busy parts of Venice (although it is by no means quiet). Close to the hotel there are many restaurants and cafes, and in general I found these much better than the restaurants near San Marco or the Rialto Bridge. Being quite small, it's possible to walk to to most parts of Venice from the hotel but if you can't be bothered doing that then there are a number of water bus stops nearby. The hotel itself is comfortable and the staff are friendly and helpful (although some were much more knowledgeable than others). Our room was on the top floor and had a couple of big windows so we could let the fresh air in and there is also air conditioning in the room. It had a good sized bathroom, was quiet once the windows were shut, and was generally comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good - with qualifications...”
Reviews.Author: Sculthorpe-Pike
Reviews.Content: We had studied all the reviews and we were expecting a really friendly welcome but I guess that, as in most of Venice, the tourists are viewed as a tedious but necessary part of the economy. The welcome wasn't as warm as we had expected and the breakfasts were mediocre to say the least. We overcame that by supplementing breakfast at the local bar and/or pizza stall (I'm not a fast food fan but these pizza's are very authentic and more-ish). The room at Ca Zose was good however, and the location is pretty much perfect with quieter evenings of strolling around but yet close to all the razamatazz of St Marks when needed. The proximity to the fab Peggy Guggenheim art museum and the Accademia was a plus. We found Venetians to be somewhat arrogant on the whole but with a few great exceptions, normally the younger variety. Four days was almost enough and a week would be too long unless you are a Venetian fanatic. Murano was a tad too dull and the glass museum there has missed a great chance to provide a superb 'wow!' factor. Frankly I think there are better glass shops on the main island of Venice - with some remarkable pieces of art therein. Vivaldi's Four Seasons in the church at San Vidal is a must - even for non-classical musico's. Here's a great tip - definitely take a shared taxi back to the airport. It's not expensive - around 27 Euros - and the trip goes through several otherwise unexplored canals and then a hair-flying, high speed dash across the lagoon. FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Convenient Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: dklascell
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The room was huge, the bathroom was very nice and the staff is very welcoming and helpful. Great continental breakfast, and the best part is the staff makes you coffee/tea/lattes to your order. It was the best "American Coffee" we had our whole trip! The hotel is located very close to the water bus and just far enough away from the touristy area to have a more quiet and relaxing stay in Venice. Try to get a room with a view of the canal from the hotel window- it is wonderful to sit at drink wine while staring out the window! The only thing we didn't love was the mattress was much too hard for our taste and caused us both to toss and turn all night. Other than that, we had a wonderful stay here!

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: RAYCAM
Reviews.Content: There were 7 in our party staying in 4 rooms. Graziella and Valentina are excellent hostesses as are all their staff. The hotel is clean, the breakfast excellent and the price very reasonable. The position is superb for all of Venice and public transport. We arrived by water taxi from the airport straight to the jetty by the hotel - literally 10 paces! We stayed 2 nights before getting a water taxi to our cruise ship ( arranged by Graziella). She had kindly allowed 3 of us to leave our cases at the hotel after our cruise as we had the whole day before catching a late flight and even printed our boarding cards for us. Graziella also organised our water taxi back to the airport. How good is that! Thanks to our hosts and their staff for making everything so easy for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good impression of a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: yursky
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to the vaporetto, nice quiet area. Friendly staff, a normal breakfast. A good hotel for little money.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at the best possible location”
Reviews.Author: GeerardRotterdam
Reviews.Content: Only a few steps away from Vaporetta station Salute is the Locanda Ca Zose, located in Dorsoduro area, in our opinion the best location for a Venice trip. Dorsodurso is a romantic and happening area, but more local then the touristic Plaza S Marco. The Hotel is clean, nice and has venetian style rooms. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel run by lovely people”
Reviews.Author: colpat36
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in February 2011 and thought the hotel was very good value for money. The sisters that run it were very helpful and their breakfast and night staff were lovely. We enjoyed the breakfasts - bread, cheese, salami/meat, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, toast, great coffee. The room was spotless, a reasonable size and comfortable. The hotel is minutes from the Salute vaporetto stop and a short walk from the Academia vaporetto stop. There are restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, we would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: Joe90_11
Reviews.Content: The friendly, multi-lingual owners and the position of this locanda (inn) in the 'Dorsoduro' sestieri (district), make it both a great choice for a romantic stay and city/cultural break. It was a couple of hundred metres from the nearest waterbus stop: 'Salute', down some typically interesting passages (Tip: Book Travel card online >7 days in advance of planned use). We went first week in February and as such got a good rate for the room. First time we have ever attended a classical concert: Vivaldi in local (grand!) church; a MUST while in Venice (circa â‚¬25 pp).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Good City”
Reviews.Author: jaybark
Reviews.Content: Visited Venice and splurged a little bit to get a nicer room as a birthday gift. The room was nice, but did not have the "wow" factor I'd been hoping for. The hotel is very clean and formal but not grand. The location is nice if you don't mind walking or putting down the money for the water bus/taxies. It is just two or three minutes from the Salute station. It is a five or so minute walk over to the Academy and the bridge that leads you to the other side and across toward St. Marks. You can walk to St. Marks in about 15-20 minutes, if you don't take too much time to admire the Venetian architecture. The staff was competent. They were not overly friendly, but there was no problem at all. They offered to arrange transportation and a wake-up call for our early morning departure. The breakfast that was included was adequate. The coffee was wonderful. Overall it was a good, but not great hotel. We enjoyed the stay and would consider returning there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gavbo26
Reviews.Content: I tayed here on a recent trip with my girlfriend. Never having been to Venice before, it was initially a bit confusing to find, but we were rescued by a local old Italian lady whose sole purpose appeared to be wandering around the streets redirecting lost tourists to their hotels! After eventually getting to know and explore Venice a bit more, the hotel is in a great location, ideal for walking to all the well known areas but not in a loud main street so is quite peaceful also. However.....our only complaint (and not a fault of the hotel) is that we were unfortunate enough to have someone next to us whose snoring was off the richter scale...(we presume it was a human, !!!) so sadly that spoilt our sleep considerably. The staff were accommodating but we had to endure it as the hotel was fully booked. That said, the staff were pleasant, and the main lady we ecountered (one of the sisters) was extremely pleasant and helpful, suggesting eating places and advising us in detail of how to travel to various places. As other reviews have mentioned, the rooms don't have all the mod cons and the latest technology but all in all we have no major complaints. I would say that if you are going to Venice expecting to stay in the height of luxury and want every gadget possible at your disposal then this is not the place for you. If you are going to Venice however for a nice time, to see the city and explore for a few days or so then you cannot go far wrong with this place. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, welcoming place to stay in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: gradiacz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca' Zose for eight nights in December 2010 - January 2011. Valentina and Graziella are gracious, warm, inviting and helpful, especially for first-time visitors to Venice. Even with our last-minute travel changes due to weather, they were accommodating 'above and beyond" and went out of their way to make us feel right at home. The location is perfect, the amenities are superb and the hosts are the best! We definitely recommend Ca' Zose and we won't have to search for a place to stay when we return to Venice - no question, it will be Ca Zose.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Venezia”
Reviews.Author: rk1400
Reviews.Content: Winter in Venice is magical when the low setting sun adds gold to every view. The weather was perfect - cold enough comfortably to walk for miles and crisp enough in the evenings for the lights to sparkle. And, among all these glittering prizes, the modest little Ca' Zose is another gem. Set near the Salute its location is as near perfect as you could wish - just off the beaten track but still in the heart of things. The rooms are quirky rather than the mass market luxury of the, 'it's Tuesday it must be Venice' variety, where you could be anywhere - from Wellington to Warsaw or Washington - as there is no atmosphere and all is homogenised. Go out for breakfast - it's not really their thing and the local cafes are great. However, that's no criticism, the sisters who run the hotel are supberb - quite simply the best, least affected, most effortlessly competent service I've ever encountered. I don't want to recommend the Ca' Zose - I want to keep it a secret, just for me!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, convenient with great hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieLovesItaly
Reviews.Content: We loved the location near the Salute vaporetto stop and lovely shops. Graziella and Valentina were wonderful hosts and the delicious breakfast included a good variety of choices. We stayed 3 nights and hated to leave. I particularly loved the beautiful wooden (original?) beamed ceiling in our top floor room. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Find”
Reviews.Author: TeresaandNick
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on Trip Advisor and based on the reviews we booked it. We were not disappointed!! The hotel was amazing! Graziella e Valentina were gracious hosts and provide excellent recommendations and services. The rooms were very spacious and were a pleasant surprise. The hotel is close to the attractions either by water bus or walking. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like authentic Venice”
Reviews.Author: sierradog1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before a cruise that departed from Venice. We took a private water taxi from the hotel (we were exhausted from the flight) and were dropped off right outside the hotel--since the hotel is located on a canal. The hotel is located near the Academia bridge and is in a neighborhood near the Guggenheim that seems residential, but also has wonderful shops and restaurants. It's easy to get anywhere you like in Venice from this hotel because of the proximity to the Tragheto and also to the waterbus. We had booked one of the less expensive rooms-it was very clean and the size was adequate. Our windows overlooked the "street" and gave us a taste of what it is like to live in Venice. The street is more like a narrow alleyway--only wide enough for 2-3 people to walk side by side. Other reviewers had described the bathroom as small--I found it to be a decent size. The breakfast was much more than expected. There was even someone there who made coffee on demand--Italian or American. The front desk clerk was extremely helpful--booking our water taxi to go to the cruise ship (even arguing with them about the price for us), supplying us with maps and directions, and making restaurant suggestions and reservations. Overall--this was an excellent hotel that I would not hesitate to recommend to others! I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, but still easy to get to sights”
Reviews.Author: awayfromjay
Reviews.Content: We loved Venice and this hotel was a great find. The cost during November was very reasonable and the location was perfect for us. Near the Salute water bus stop, it took us about 45 minutes from the train station to reach the hotel. Easily walkable to Accademia and several areas with numerous cafes. We used the traghetto near the Salute stop to quickly get to Saint Mark's. At night the street next to the hotel was quiet and peaceful. Internet usage was limited to wireless access from the lobby and costs about 1.50 Euro per half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MimieJo
Reviews.Content: Great, Great, Great Hotel. We stayed for 2 nights earlier this month and we loved it. The room was quite cozy and very comfortable. The bathroom was clean. The staff was very nice & helpful. Hopefully, we will be back to stay with them again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, a little noisy, smallish bathroom, nice staff, good bfast”
Reviews.Author: checkerAz69
Reviews.Content: All things considered, we were quite pleased with the hotel. The location is very good with respect to the vaporetto stops and major sites. Staff was helpful and treated us well. Breakfast was the usual assortment of breads pastries , meats, cheeses, cereal. The bathroom was a little problematic with the toilet too close to the shower. One needs to sit a little sideways and we ain't big folk. I'd recommend that a couple of additional pillows be placed in the room as the pillows were pretty thin. There's a fair amount of noise from adjoining rooms and outside. The former I attribute to thin walls, the latter to the echo-y surroundings and drunk 2am-ers.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem of a hotel with great service and location”
Reviews.Author: shootr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca Zose for five nights in October. We chose the place because my wife and I were traveling with our elderly mothers - each 80yrs+ - and so location close to the vaporettos was important - they couldn't walk far - and also the hotel was close to the art galleries and only one ferry stop to St, Marks Square. The hotel was a little gem. The rooms were beautifully appointed, the beds comfy, and there was plenty of space. My wife and I got upgraded to a suite, and we had a lovely view out to a small canal outside. With the windows closed at night, it was very quiet. Our mothers had a room at the back which was perfect for them. Our daughter joined us and the two sisters who run the hotel, Graziella and Valentina, put an extra bed in our room which saved us money. They were gorgeous hosts, and nothing was too much trouble. They ended up giving us free internet for our stay, which was very kind of them. The breakfast was all you could want - fabulous coffees and you could get how ever many you wanted, it was no problem. The best thing about the hotel was the service by the two lovely sisters at the front desk, and the location - and it was good value for money. I've stayed in Venice before, but would stay here again in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, quaint and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Cashester
Reviews.Content: This charming, intimate hotel is located in a nice area on a small side canal just off the Grand Canal, an easy walk to Salute vaporetta stop where you can quickly cross to St. Mark's Square. The hotel photos are accurate. Our spacious room had a king-sized bed, an armoire with a safe, a small table with two chairs, a desk with a TV and mini-bar, and a bathroom with toilet, bidet, sink and shower. The hand-painted furniture, exposed beams and rich fabrics made the room pleasant, cozy and inviting, great for couples seeking romance. The breakfast included pastries, a choice of cereals, fruit, yogurt, eggs and sliced meats. Excellent coffee! The rooms are clean, the service and staff helpful, friendly and efficient. The lobby is small but does have WiFi available for a low fee. Some people may need to consider that there is no elevator and that the shower has an approximately 2'x2' base, although our good-sized traveling companion managed just fine. It helps that the shower head height is adjustable. If we return to Venice we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value”
Reviews.Author: solly316
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and found the location perfect and relatively quiet. The room was adequate and the bed comfy. Breakfast was basic, no frills, but the room was bit small to accomodate the morning rush. That is the only negative. The owners are helpful and the staff friendly. I paid cash and got a great rate - $95 in August. A great value for those who don't need 5-star accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & Value!”
Reviews.Author: Sethareli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, could'nt fault it really. Venice in August is manic, and this hotel is right near the large Basillica, open to the breeze of the sea and just across the Grnad Canal from St Mark's Square. That being said, walking is a must in Venice & so staying here proves to be a pleasure. It's kind of off the beaten track and is yet almost on top of the Guggenheim museum, access to the Basillica, access to 1 of 3 bridges across the canal & slap in the centre of the cultural area so surrounded by fancy glass and sculpture shops (my girlfriend was in heaven). The room was large and decorated in a nice authentic Italian Style with good air con and a very clean bathroom. Some people might moan that the shower is too small but at the end of the day it's there to shower not lie down in. Just get on with it! One of the nicest features, was that the mini bar is cheap, especially for Venice! There was a selection of red, white and prosecco (standard size bottles) on the dressing table at â‚¬4 each which is a pleasurable welcome when your'e in need of a quick drink after a hot travel in August! Breakfast was just right for what you expect on the continent - croissants, yoghurts, cheeses, ham e.t.c. The greeting in the hotel is friendly and helpful, which always makes for a better stay & breakfast ran until 10.00 allowing a lie in after all that Venice walking. I would gladly stay there again - At Â£60 per night in Venice, it's fantastic value & like I mentioned earlier, you'll welcome the quietness of the area without moving away from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: 255060Mark
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 9 nights in July and found my stay here thoroughly enjoyable. The staff were extremely helpful - especially Valentina who was extremely helpful from the moment of arrival. The breakfast was excellent. The rooms were comfortable and well-kept. Great location close to 2 vaporetto stops ( Salute and Zattere).

Reviews.Title: “made out first experience of Venice very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: taniafilus
Reviews.Content: the staff could not be more helpful and polite. We did not have a train until late in the evening and were able to leave our luggage safely. Venice in July was extremely hot and to have an air conditioned room was such a relief after a days sight seeing. The room and bathroom were spotless. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely & clean rooms & friendly owners”
Reviews.Author: halfwaymark
Reviews.Content: We had made a mistake on my booking of Ca Zose for a Mon & Tue, whereas we'd intended to stay Sun & Mon. So when we turned up on Sun and realised my mistake at the reception desk, I was wondering where we were going to put up for that night. Grace, one of the owners (other is her sister, Valentina), was very kind. They had 1 last room available for that day, and she was very accomodating in bringing forward my booking from a wrong Mon &Tue, to the correct Sun & Mon without any additional cost. Other establishments may not have been so kind, hence we were really impressed with Ca Zose from that aspect. That room we were given was clean, and very beautifully decorated. Breakfast was good. Wi-fi is free for 30 mins in the lobby/ breakfast area. If you wish to use any longer, you can purchase it for a small fee. Location was a small walk away from the water taxi station - Salute. The location is definitely in one of the nicer parts of Venice. There is a supermarket, Billa, about 15 minutes walk from the B&B where you can get necessities like water/ fruits/ snacks etc. All in all, a great experience for my wife and I in Venice. Definitely would recommend to anyone. Make sure to visit Burano (lace) and Murano (glass), to get away from the hustle and bustle of the main island.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm to return to at the end of a busy day”
Reviews.Author: Nelle1
Reviews.Content: A good sized, very clean and well furnished bedroom in a comfortable and friendly hotel with pleasant staff and helpful owners.Continental style breakfast was sufficient to start the day. The hotel was well situated in a quiet street in the Accademmia area. Within walking distance of all the main attractions. There are a few select art and glassware shops nearby. Hotel is close to a vaporetta stop, The Peggy Guilenheimm Museum, a Michelin recommended restaurant and there are a number of decent eateries in close proximity. The area around the hotel is very quiet in the evenings ensuring an undisturbed sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: dom_nique
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific experience staying at this hotel. The owners/staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was a good size, AC worked perfectly, the bathroom was spotless and modern (good water pressure, lots of hot water). There are drinks in the small fridge that you can purchase for a small fee. You can check the internet using the hotel's laptop for a small price- very practical! The breakfast was more than adequate (pastries, bread, cold meats, boiled eggs, cereal, juice, coffee, etc.). I personally think the location is the best in Venice. Not far from the action of San Marco (a very enjoyable 20 minute stroll or 5 minutes if you take the 50 cents traghetto which is very close to the hotel), but at the same time, the neighbourhood is quieter than other areas. My only complaint is that the bed was very hard. I'm not used to sleeping on such a hard bed, and after three nights, my back was growing tired. If you're looking for a nice romantic quiet restaurant in Venice, try Sempione (near San Marco). Valentina (one of the owners of the hotel) made reservations for us one evening (she knows Luigi, the owner of the restaurant). Make sure to reserve a table next to the window!! It opens up on the canal and you're at eye-level with the gondeliers rowing by! Very cute! My fiance proposed there and the setting was absolutely perfect! : ) Another great restaurant (not on a canal but still has a romantic outdoor setting) is Locanda Montin, which is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Delicious food!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: benoitm80
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect such a good hotel when I read some reviews. The hotel has an ideal location. Owners and personel are friendly and helpful. Rooms are nice and clean. Don't expect any nice view from your window (only very few palace in Venice can afford such). Breakfast is ok, not a 5* restaurant but reasonable sweet-salty choice without limit.

Reviews.Title: “So lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole072
Reviews.Content: I want to thank the proprietors of Ca Zose. Thanks Valentina!!!!! This hotel is so lovely. It is placed on a canal w/ such easy access to everything. I will certainly stay there every time I visit Venice. The staff was sooooo kind and accommodating. My only complaint is, by the end of our stay, we all had bug bites all over our faces. It was so odd, because we never saw the bugs and our beds were clean. We did sleep w/ our windows open, due to the AC being weak, so we think they must have come in through the windows. But like I said, otherwise it was a wonderful stay.....

Reviews.Title: “Friendly welcome and simple clean accommodation in a good area”
Reviews.Author: mapreader2008
Reviews.Content: Stafff all friendly and obliging. Room clean and attractive decor with clean en suite although shower was a little on small side. We had hot wate with decent pressure when we needed it though., Toiletries provided and room serviced each day. Comfort wa definitely spoilt though by two single mattresses on a double bed. Breakfast was fine. Continental style offering enough variety of meats, cereal, fruit, youghurts, bread rolls, toast etc with very nice freshly made coffee. We only managed to get Italian channels on the television and it would have helped to follow the volcano problems with an English news channel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: jkl_Reed
Reviews.Content: What a find! We selected this hotel by looking on google maps, we wanted a room on a small canal. And we were not disappointed. We had a lovely room, overlooking a small canal, perfect for sitting in the late afternoon, sipping a prosecco, watching the activity on the canal, and listening to the strains of Puccini from the store opposite. Magic! The managers and staff of the hotel were all just wonderful, kind, helpful and generous. Great breakfasts too. Dorsoduro is perfect - close to all the action of San Marco, just a short hop in the traghetto - but peaceful and quiet. If we go to Venice again, we will definitely try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cosy hotel with great welcoming”
Reviews.Author: venustas
Reviews.Content: very nice, cosy, little hotel. True atmosphere. We appreciate very much the warm, helpful and friendly welcoming of the owners (2 venitian sisters).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly & helpful staff, and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: WA_Wombat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short distance from the Salute vaperotto stop which is just across the canal from St Mark's Square, so it is an ideal location for easy access to the major tourist attractions in Venice. The area is fairly quiet and the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a good size, comfortable and clean. Breakfast was included in the room rate, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, tiny, perfect hotel with a great location. My new favorite in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: STW5
Reviews.Content: Great quiet location in the Dorsoduro sestrier next to La Salute. This hotel is a tiny gem and everything works just right. The rooms are small but comfortable and have a lot of character for their size--massive oak rafter beams were lovely in our high-ceilinged little room (and the beams were very clean like everything else in the hotel). The bathroom in our room was bright, modern, and reassuring and had everything in place, however small the shower, and all spotless. The breakfast room and small lobby was just as spotless and perfect--and tastefully done. Was proud to invite people to meet us at our hotel. The staff are unfailingly attentive, friendly but circumspect, professional, and respectful of privacy. Our room was quiet and good for sleeping even though it was probably the loudest room the hotel has since has a lovely view and faces out on a lovely canal and marble bridge. This means, if you have the window open, you hear the occasional working boat in the wee hours, but it is part of the charm of Venice to have canal sounds. Other guests staying in the other side of the hotel reported their rooms were absolutely quiet at night. Our only reservation was the sparseness of the bedding--one small pillow each seems too little after one is accustomed to two. Also the mattress was firmer than you'd expect in a place like this--too firm for me and I like a firm mattress. The managment might have been happy to supply extra pillows but I never got around to asking, happy as I was in the place. Wifi available for 5 Euros per hour which seems steep in Europe where wifi is so available. But there was no free public access wifi in Venice anywhere , that I could find this last week anywhere, and Ca' Zose's price was on a par with what is found in an internet cafe--if you can find one.

Reviews.Title: “This is an excelent Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Rich8043
Reviews.Content: The Ca Zose Hotel is family operated hotel, with the most gracious hospitality. The owners speak English and are most helpful with Venetian Tours, Restaurants and go out of their way to help with special needs. The Hotel is a newly renovated building and is decorated in the most beautiful Venetian style with a view of one of the side canals. There is a room for breakfast in the morning and tea in the afternoon. Most of the pastries are freshly baked. The Hotel is conveniently located to the Guggenheim Museum, the water taxies and walking distance to St. Marco Square.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: verdi2
Reviews.Content: If you want a truly Venetian hotel that is full of atmosphere without costing a fortune, Hotel Ca Zose has to be the winner. After several trips to Venice staying in mediocre hotels, we came across this one and have returned many times. Value for money, beautiful rooms, cleanliness and the most delightful owners make a stay in Venice a delightful experience. Returning to the hotel in the quieter Dorsoduro area after a hectic day sight-seeing makes you appreciate another aspect of Venice with its tranquil canals and beautiful buildings although major art galleries are not far away. We have recommended Hotel Ca Zose to many friends and none have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to go with your girlfriend /wife”
Reviews.Author: RRMBarcelona
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the hotel on February 2010 for the Carnival and I do recommend the hotel. The main reasons are below: - The hotel's room are big, with plenty of room, clean and not noisy. - The hotel is clean and the service (specially the receptionist) is very very kind. - The hotel placement is 10 min. walking far from St. Marco. So, I do recommend the hotel for staying calmly with your girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Doge49
Reviews.Content: Great position - handy for vaporetto & Accademia bridge - Peggy Gugenheim's collection next door. Economical place to stay. Well run - friendly staff. I stayed B&B & ate out in the evenings

Reviews.Title: “fantastic Venetian Locanda”
Reviews.Author: maurizo92
Reviews.Content: I suggest so much this warm and confortable small hotel in a fanfastic place of Venice. You can discovery the wonderful atmosphere of Venetian People, cause the Owner are two Venetian sister, Valentina & Graziella, who can help you anytime and suggest you the really undiscovered Venetian "calle" and local pub "baccari". excellent view and easy to go everywere in Venice (just in front San Marco square, crossed canal grande by "Gondola bus" as venetian habitant.) enjoy. maurice

Reviews.Title: “Great small family owned hotel near the Guggenheim and Pinault museums.”
Reviews.Author: AndiamoPronto
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in April on the internet, stayed for a few days, and then went back in December for a few more days. My sister and brother-in-law were supposed to meet us and stay but got stuck in the London airport due to snow. The hotel did not charge us for the cancellation. The staff is incredibly friendly and gave us a great tip on a reasonably priced restaurant with excellent local food. The location can't be beat. We walked everywhere from here and the amazing, new Pinault museum is only a block away. Don't miss it. Ample breakfast, small but comfortable rooms. A friend left us a bottle of wine in March, the owners forgot to give it to us, offered to send it to the US, I said no, and they kept it for nine months until we returned in December. That's service! Love this place, the people, and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel: Care, Comfort, Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Susana007
Reviews.Content: Care: Hotel is family owned (gracious sisters) with helpful staff on canal in safe area of Dorsoduro in Venice. Comfort: Romantic venetian decor (2003); some rooms with 17th C. beams, view of canal & bridge; reasonably priced compared to many; clean, pretty bathrooms (our trips and 3 rooms have had showers only); great morning cappuccino - European breakfast menu. Convenience: In a city of canals/bridges, arriving with luggage over one small bridge to Hotel is easy! ~ 5 min. walk to vaporetto (public water "bus") stop Santa Maria della Salute; 1/4 block to traghetto (public transportation gondola crossing Grand Canal); ~ Walk to P. Guggenheim Museum, Academia and bridge, many famous squares; ~ Short ride to Basilica San Marco, and connections to Lido and Murano islands; ~ Excellent restaurants in neighborhood (favorite = Casin dei Nobili); ~ If you have read and loved D. Leon books re: Venice: you better plan to stay a week! ~ We have stayed here 3 times(spouse, and college age family member) and would never consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “adequate, but expensive for the quaility”
Reviews.Author: Traveler5051
Reviews.Content: The best thing this hotel has going for it is its location in Dorsoduro near the Accademia. But in general I found the hotel expensive for what it had to offer. Moreover I had a bad experience checking in. I arrived in early October and was given a room overlooking a noisy side street - which would have been OK, except the air conditioning was turned off(I was told air conditioning in Venice is not permitted after October 1). Therefore I needed to leave the window open to the noise below. After much prodding, I was given a quieter room overlooking a small interior area way. The hotel advertises that it has air conditioning and the Venice weather in October can be warm. One down side of leaving the window open at night was the invasion of mosquitos. My room was slightly bigger than a large closet, but clean and quiet. While Venice is expensive, the Ca Zose is priced too high for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: skimomkl
Reviews.Content: My 23 yr old daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights in Sept. We felt very, very safe and loved our location. We were away from the crowds and in the evening felt like we had the place to ourselves. We rode the gondola which was right around the corner over to the square ( just 1 euro)one of our best memories. Rooms are quaint and very clean. Walls are thin-baby next door woke me up once, but mostly very quiet place. Breakfast is OK. We would stay here when we come back to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: PBGardener
Reviews.Content: Venice is a very expensive city with many areas that are just crawling with tourists and people in the tourist trade. Locanda Ca Zose was a pleasant relief from both those problems. The room was very affordable, relatively speaking, and we felt it was a good value for the money. We paid approx. 185E per night (cash price) for three nights, and our room was very large. In addition to our double bed there was a separate twin which we used for storing luggage, but could easily have accommodated a third person. We also had a small sitting area with a table and 2 chairs, as well as a desk with a hidden minifridge in the cabinet. The bathroom was average size for Europe, which means fairly compact by American standards, but it was clean and well-maintained, and the fixtures were nice. Our room looked over the calle in front of the hotel, not the canal, but I don't see how a canal view would be better. Because there are mosquitoes in Venice most of the year (which the hotel staff warned us about!) you MUST keep windows closed from late evening through morning, so there would not be much opportunity to enjoy a canal view. Breakfast was adequate but not great. The coffee / cappuccino was good, but everything else was pre-packed (pastries, yogurt, jams). We would have liked to have eggs or cold cuts in addition to what was offered. But the available items were presented nicely and staff was very prompt in delivering coffee and other beverages. The hotel staff was very accommodating, and it was a nice bonus to find, at this price, a location where the front desk was staffed 24 hours each day. The hotel helpfully arranged a very early morning water taxi to the airport, which arrived on time and picked us up directly outside the hotel. It's expensive (100E) but necessary for early morning flights, and the hotel made it convenient for us. The location in Dorsoduro is just fantastic. Within easy walking distance are major sights like the Salute, Accademia, and Ca'Rezzonico, as well as the San Marco area, but Dorsoduro feels "off the beaten path" and authentically Venetian. Being close to the Peggy Guggenheim collection and the Accademia Gallery means that the area around the hotel is home to a number of stores selling high quality paintings, prints and glass sculptures. The restaurants and bars are generally more affordable than the locations that surround Rialto or San Marco, but of course nothing is Venice is cheap. And walking down to the Dogana point at night is a very special experience - surprisingly peaceful and quiet in a city that can often feel somewhat crowded and claustrophobic. We would definitely stay at Ca Zose if we have the opportunity to visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: tomart
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in September and found it to be well-run by friendly, helpful owners and staff. The room we had was quite spacious, clean with efficient air conditioning. The bathroom was neat and tidy with a good shower (ie plenty of hot water). Breakfasts were really only average in terms of quality and rather limited in what was on offer. Coffe, however, was good. The breakfast room is very small and quickly becomes crowded and feels rather cramped.The staff on duty, though, were very pleasant and helpful. The location is excellent: 5-10 minutes to Accadamadia and Guggenheim and a couple of minutes to the Salute stop. Set next to a quiet canal, it really is well-placed. Near Accadamia is Taverna San Trovaso which is worth a visit - good food reasonably priced. Ca Zose offers fair value for money and given the great location (and the other plus points) we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I was sorry to leave it!”
Reviews.Author: 28A
Reviews.Content: This small locanda in the Dorsoduro is run by two sisters who make you feel as if the hotel is your own home in Venice. Whether you need a water taxi booked, restaurant or shopping suggestions, or tips on getting where you're going - either Valentina or Graziella will go to no end of trouble to help you out. The location, almost in the shadow of the Salute, is ideal..we were home at night after the opera in la Fenice - on the other side of the canal- in ten minutes, one stop on the vaparetto. A 'trageheto', the gondola that will ferry you across the canal for 50 cent- is even closer (but has restricted operating hours). My friend's room and mine both had ancient beamed ceilings and a view of a small canal and bridge. The rooms are a comfortable size, furnished in Venetian style, with everything you could need including a TV and minibar, and a modern tiled bathroom. The staff who help the sisters with running the hotel are as accommodating as the owners themselves. The rates are modest enough that we splurged on a private water taxi to and from the airport. Arriving at the hotel steps by boat certainly added to the Venetian experience and was very well worth the cost (100 euro each way for up to four people).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on the cheap”
Reviews.Author: sarahl0uise
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel was the location which was only one vaporetto stop to San Marco. I booked two rooms and one was huge and the other only about half the size so I guess they give you what they have regardless of price. The rooms were really nicely decorated in a Venetian style and the air conditioning was great. The breakfast was pretty bad though but at this price, you can afford to go out for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value room; good air conditioning; keep windows closed b/c of mosquitos”
Reviews.Author: momraven
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and comfortable for myself, my friend, and her 10 year old daughter. The breakfast was mediocre each of the 4 days we stayed: canned peaches; no fresh fruit; supermarket purchased croissants and other supermarket purchased pastries; warm yoghurt; excellent coffee; bottled juice; toast, one type of small wrapped packages of supermarket cheese. Excellent cappuchino and/or expresso. The two sisters who run the hotel (own it, too, I believe) were helpful. With no warning about mosquitoes, we slept with the windows open. All three of us were covered with large mosquito bites the following morning. After complaining, a mosquito killing plug in gadget was provided (be sure you ask for it or do NOT leave your windows open) and no further problem w/ mosquitoes. No elevator. Hauling suitcases up and down stairs is not easy for women. Good and fairly quiet location. Good air conditioning, so once you know about the mosquitoes, just leave the air conditioning on. Would rate hotel much higher if had been advised re. mosquito problem and if had provided fresh baked (bakery, not supermarket) croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: tikiliki
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 6 nights recently with my girlfriend. The thing I like best is the location. Just across the river from San Marco square. You take the little gondola shuttle and you are in all the action in 5 minutes. However, the best part is that since this is across the river it is quiet and not crowded. Also, less touristy and better restaurants in this area. I found the lady owners helpful, friendly and a good sense of humor. The night desk person, Eric was also very helpful. The only criticism I have is that I like more protein with my breakfast and cheese and yogurt got a little old for me. Not a problem, I just had more protein with lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Coffee, Tea, Cappuccino?”
Reviews.Author: Lori-Alexandria
Reviews.Content: Say that three times fast! That's what they ask you the minute you walk into the breakfast room in the morning. It's a bit of an assault, but they mean well. The staff was helpful, the breakfast was standard. The hotel was in a great location in Dosoduro just down the block from the Peggy Gugenheim Collection and the price was very reasonable. The room was big and comfortable EXCEPT for the mosquitoes. I asked about them at the front desk and all the lady could say was, yes, they're a problem. Unfortunately, I have "sweet blood" and the darn things love to bite me. I ended up with a dozen bites in the course of one night, half of which were on my face. My husband only got a couple, lucky duck. But even with the mosquitoes, I'd still recommend this place because it's in a great location, very close to the Vaporetto stop "Salute" and was a very good value. They do not offer a computer for guests, but they do have WiFi if you bring your own laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa44
Reviews.Content: Rooms - lovely, very clean and spacious, the bed was really comfortable. Staff - they really couldn't do anymore for you. We were greeted warmly and advised we had been upgraded which was a lovely surprise. When we asked questions regarding restaurants, etc staff always had time for us. That included both the owners and other staff. Reception - the desk is manned 24 hours a day which was very reassuring. Breakfast - continental as is described. We found the breakfast more than sufficient, with yoghurts, fresh fruit, cereal, toast, etc. Locality - perfect!! It was two minutes walk from where you get on/off the water bus and very near St Maria church. It was lovely and quiet on a night so no problems with noisy restaurants, passers by. All in all this hotel was an excellent starting point for our trip to Venice and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic personal service at a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andysevenoaks
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at Locanda Ca Zose in May 2009 and were extremely impressed. The hotel can be reached directly from Marco polo airport using the Alilaguna waterbus red or blue line. The instructions on the hotel web site are easy to follow and, as the hotel looks like it does in the pictures, it is easy to find. The hotel is in typical Venetian style and our room was clean, large and full of character with exposed beams in the ceiling. The staff were helpful and, unlike in some larger hotels, extremely friendly. The hotel is in the quiet Dorsoduro area of the city, next to Basillica de santa maria della salute (a major landmark). It is only a couple of minutes across the grand canal to San Marcos, but I would recommend the 15 minute walk through the streets of Venice via ponte dellâ€™ Accademia to discover the real Venice. On the way youâ€™ll pass numerous beautiful churches and charming restaurants. In summary, this hotel offered the perfect balance of quiet location and easy access to the major site. When I return to Venice I will certainly return to Locanda Ca Zose.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CJE1978
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Cazose and we cannot rate it highly enough. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was very clean, the shower had a plentiful supply of hot water at all times of day and the breakfasts were delicious. The location is central but quiet. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine six day stay in November 2008”
Reviews.Author: patmanny
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice for a six day vacation. Briefly, this was a wonderful hotel. The staff was most helpful, and went out of their way to provide restaurant and touring perspectives. This was most helpful and appreciated. A short walk to two vaporetto stops. The rooms were fine. The location was quiet and relaxed, and a short walk to all the gelato anyone could want. Put another way, we were in good hands. Valentina and Graziella are fine hosts. pat and manny nyc

Reviews.Title: “very convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: butsy1
Reviews.Content: we had a very comfortable stay for 5 nights with no problems at all. the location is the best thing about the hotel- convenient but very quiet. dorsoduro is a fantastic part of the city to stay in. Rooms very clean and staffed 24 hrs so no worries if you get in late

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeenaTellervo
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the reviews that I read - booked a room for 3 nights. Great location - very clean - wonderful place. I would recommend anyone who likes a small hotel, Dorsoduro location, easy access to vaporetto. Helped with restaurant recommendations - absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: MGlady15
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in this charming hotel. Location was ideal...very close to the Salute water bus stop, 10 minute walk from San Marco square and not too overcrowded. Outside of some steep stairs to get up to our room, we had a wonderful stay. The staff was very friendly, the included breakfast was great, and our room was clean with a large bathroom. I'd definitely recommend it - was an excellent stay for the price in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and a very good choice for a 3-generation family”
Reviews.Author: rrsrichmond
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at Locanda Ca Zose for 3 nights in early June 2008. It was fine, and the owners were kind in letting me know ahead of time what the steps and other logistics would be like for an elderly member of our group who has some trouble walking. My brother arrived around 1 a.m., and they also very kindly emailed street by street and turn by turn directions for him from the Accademia vaporetto stop-his first time in Venice, he walked to the hotel with no problem. Our two rooms and the baths were quite clean, comfortable, air conditioning worked great. I liked that it was in a quiet part of town; and walking in the area is a good introduction to the back streets of Venice. We walked over to the Guidecca Canal one evening -- that was a beautiful stroll. It's an easy, quick walk to the Salute vaporetto stop. Breakfast was OK-friendly staff, a small, somewhat cramped breakfast room. Decent pastries, cereal, etc., but a bigger selection would have been nice, such as fresh fruit and a selection of cheeses. But earlier reviews had told us already about breakfast choices. It was a good introduction to Venice and a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mangie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ca' Zose for two nights the first weekend in June 2008. What a charming hotel. The location was absolutely wonderful in the quiet section of Dorsoduro. It was only a two minute walk to the Salute water taxi stop. The hotel was easy to find with a great map, which I highly recommend, its so easy to get lost in Venice. We loved wondering the streets near the hotel, Venice is so beautiful and what an amazing city. The hotel is small and wonderfully managed. Our room was very clean and a good size. The bathroom was quite large with a full tub shower. The bed was comfortable especially after a long day of walking the streets of Venice. The room was decorated in a lovely Venetian Style that we both just loved. Our room was located on the second floor and it was just so quiet, no complaints of noise at all. Air condition was included, which we definitely needed. Breakfast was included and perfect for getting our day started. It included items such as pastries, cereal, various breads for the toaster, coffee, tea, etc. The staff was very polite and spoke perfect english. We got a great restaurant recommendation, I don't remember the exact name, it was something like La Gondolla, but it was one of the best meals we ever had. The price of the hotel was much cheaper then most hotels in Venice. Venice is a very expensive city, so the Ca' Zose was a great find and I highly recommend it. We really enjoyed our stay and it made our visit to Venice even better. We hope to visit Venice again someday in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back in a minute”
Reviews.Author: LudwigX
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the accomodations but what really made the difference were Valentina, Graziella & the other staff: all were extremely friendly and helfpful. We'd go back in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice and happy with Ca Zose”
Reviews.Author: LondonChris1975
Reviews.Content: Super location in the back streets just across the grand canal from Piazza San Marco and about 2 minutes walk from the Salute Vaporetto stop and you can walk pretty much anywhere in 25 minutes. We were a bit worried about finding the place from other reports but it was dead easy. The rooms are clean and tidy and in the â€˜Venetianâ€™ style. The beds are comfy and the shower was excellent with great water pressure. The breakfast are not the best and they could do better easily on this point. The staff ranged from very friendly and helpful to disinterested at best

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Mauser
Reviews.Content: Great place. Thanks to AnmChicago who put us on to this charming hotel. This hotel is owned by two sisters, Graziella and Valentina, who were a great help and full of information. This hotel was renovated 2 or 3 years ago. It's located in the Dorsoduro area, halfway between Peggy Guggenhiem Museum and La Salut Church. It's located on one of the small canals off the Grand Canal. Water taxi took us to the front door. There are two Vaporetto stops very near the hotel. We arrived October 1, 2007, in the P.M. and our rooms were ready. Our room was not as large as your average American hotel, but was certainly adequate, and the bath was large and had been updated with very nice tilework, tub, shower, vanity, toilet and bidet. We were in Venice when the air conditioning was off (the city prohibit's the use of air conditioning from the last of September until around the last of April), but made do by leaving the windows open in the day. Our room was above the street and in the morning we could hear the little footsteps of the children going to school. We had a continental breakfast every morning which was quite good. There were plenty of pastries, croissant, cereal and coffee/latte", etc. Would stay there again if we get back to Venice. Mauser

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: suffolktraveller22
Reviews.Content: <Locanda Ca' Zose is a wonderful privately owned small hotel well located, just 3-4 mins walk from the Salute boat stop and an easy walk 7-8 mins to the Academia. The two sisters who own the hotel and their staff are very helpful. The rooms whilst not large are not too small either and everything is clean and comfortable. Breakfast is included and whilst there is no fresh fruit the choice of breakfast foods is good. Having stayed there on several occasions I booked 7 double rooms recently in November for a special occasion with friends and without exception all were happy with the choice (it should be said that they were all paying for themselves)which was a relief. I am recommending the hotel as it is nice for the owners for it to be better known but also I don't want it to become so successful that when I want to stay there again I find it fully booked!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Donna_G71
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet, very comfortable place to stay. My standard room was nicely decorated and the bed was extremely comfortable. It had been cleverly furnished so it didn't seem too small at all. Other reviewers have mentioned small showers - well I'm hardly tiny and I didn't find it a problem. I actually found the shower really good. Yes, there were mosquitoes but that's what you get near the water. All the staff were very pleasant and obliging, and Valentina in particular was extremely helpful - a lovely person. I also liked the location - away from the hordes of tourists, but still very close to everything. For art lovers, the Guggenheim and the Accademia are very handy. The Salute vaporetto stop is very close by, and better still, the traghetto is even closer (50 cents to be ferried across the Grand Canal in a basic gondola - you have to try it!). Thank you Valentina and Graziella for a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quaint hotel in Italy - nice location.”
Reviews.Author: QueenOfTheRoad7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ca Zose for 2 nights. Nice location, not on the busy tourist route which I think would be noisy. Nice staff. Breakfast was adequate with cereal, pastries, coffee, yogurt, etc. Internet access was challenging -- had to pay for it in 15 minute increments and it's monitored by the government apparently due to terrorism and pedofile issues in Venice.
