After 15 mintues, it's turned off regardless if you're in the middle of an e-mail. -- And the service is very slow. Fortunately, we didn't go to Venice to do work, so it wasn't a big deal. Would recommend this hotel - -- and it's cheaper than many others. Very clean -- except the first night there were lots of mosquitoes in the room because I think someone left the windows open. No problem the second night. I would recommend this hotel. It's very near the Guggenheim museum and pretty convenient to the waterbus route. Of note - the hotel is not 90 meters from the Salute waterbus stop. It's closer - we walked right by it for quite a ways without seeing it because we were estimating the distance based on 90 meters as it said in the directions from the website. From the Salute waterbus stop, if you get to a second bridge and the Guggenheim museum, you've gone too far!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: agun21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything we expected based on the price relative to everything else in Venice. The location is convenient with a 10 min. walk to Rialto and St. Marks. Rooms are decently furnished, but much less luxiurous than their website makes them look. Service was good, but nothing special. The only negatives are - extremely small shower and the MOSQUITOS. I don't know if this is a problem in all Venice hotels, but it is a big problem at Ca Zose. Don't open the windows! When we got to the room there were plenty of little red smears on the walls, and when we left there were many more. I left Venice with more bug bites than I did leaving Costa Rica!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SmileyToronto
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Ca Zose for 3 nights at the end of Sept. 2007. Venice is the most unique and interesting city. Getting to the hotel on the Vaperetto was fun and the hotel itself is very close to the "bus/boat" stop. OUr room was very nice and very quiet. The location is the key, you are away from the mayhem of tourists in the city centre but close enough to get there comfortably, ~ 15-20 min to St. Mark's square. We loved wandering the streets near our hotel as a break from the tourist crowds elsewhere. The peggy guggenheim museum is literally 2 mintues away. We were unlucky with the weather, it was raining and cold most of the time we were in venice, but the hotel had umbrellas for our use. There was also on site internet access. One alert for people with any physical disabilities is that there are some stairs to do, and no lift. Just mention this to the staff tol ensure you get a room on the 2nd floor rather than higher up. Breakfast was adequate, buffet style. Finally, a special thank you to Valentina. We asked her to call ahead to our next destination and ensure we had a good room and she did. We arrived to Florence will an upgraded room, with no additional charge. Thank you!! We would come to this hotel again and recommend it! Ciao and happy travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: palexri
Reviews.Content: A second stay here, on this occasion of four nights, confirms Ca' Zose as a good option for those who spend their days in Venice sightseeing rather than lounging around their hotel. The location is excellent, a short walk from the Zattere water-bus stop for the airport and one stop by vaporetto from San Marco. Arriving at the Salute church you have a walk of about a minute before you arrive at the hotel. Accommodation here, as in so many other Venice hotels, is compact, but clean and tidy. My shower room was sparkling. The style is frilly-Venetian, but this is the case in most hotels here - unless the establishment is self-consciously aiming for a more contemporary look (see Ca' Pisani or Charming House if this is your thing, but be prepared to pay for it). Graziella and Valentina, who are helpful with taxi and table reservations when needed, greet guests with customary warmth and friendliness. Breakfast is carbohydrate-rich - no protein in evidence, and for me the weak point in a stay here, but you certainly won't go hungry and it has not put me off returning. All in all this hotel is good in its class and represents as good a 'budget' option as I think you'll find in what can be, for obvious reasons, a cripplingly expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Tries but too many issues”
Reviews.Author: lbearpal
Reviews.Content: This is a little hotel that is out of the hustle and bustle- just a vaporetto ride accross the canal from Piazza San Marco. The two women owners were helpful and gave excellent dinner recommendations, but the room was very small and looked right at people's balconies in the apartments accross the alleyway. The pillows were literally two inches thick, but the biggest issues were the shlep through tw buildings and up two flights of stairs with luggage and the abysmal breakfast. Warm yogurt, bad coffee (in Italy?) and dry croissants don't cut it. They would be better off not offering it. It was OK but wouldn't go back. There are better places in Venice like Locanda Orseola for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and price in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jass
Reviews.Content: This B&B is located in the Dorsoduro section of Venice, a quiet residential area, very close to the Peggy Guggenheim museum. We found all of the main attractions to be within easy walking distance, but it was great to come home to a quieter street, away from the noise and crowds. The staff was extremely accommodating, even offering coffee and cleaning our room after the posted hours. The room was small but very clean, and exactly as shown on the website([--]). Given how expensive everything was in Venice, we found this to be an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TowsonHounds
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very charming and quaint. Being our 10th wedding anniversary I had asked for a few extras such as Champagne and flowers..Graziella & Valentina not only delivered but added strawberrys and chocolate, it was a perfect touch. We had a junior suite with view of the canal and it was great . We loved the fact that the hotel is situated away from the main tourist area but still two vaporeto stops from St. Marco square. The staff was very accomodating and the anemities were modern and very clean. Overall, our stay was great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location, Great food!”
Reviews.Author: R&RWales
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3night stay at this great little hotel in Venice. We usually stay in much larger hotels owned by groups and this was only the second time we had decided to stay in an individually owned hotel. We were NOT disappointed!! (we did upgrade to a superior room) ALL the staff we met were very friendly, helpful and spoke very good english (even the night porter!) The hotel staff went out of their way to get the room cleaned so that we could have it earlier than we should have - thank you! The room was very clean and very Venician!! The decor was of a very good standard. The location is excellent for exploring Venice. The hotel is less than 5 minutes from the Salute Vapareto stop and less than 10 minutes from the Accademia bridge (one of only 3 crossing the Grand Canal!) The Hotel aslo let us leave our baggs most of the day after checking out!! The breakfast at the hotel was fantastic. Loads of pasteries/cakes, bread, cereal, yogurts, fruit etc. Nothing was too much trouble!!! For this to be a balanced report we feel we should mention a few negatives. When we arrived our shower head was broken. However this was promptly fixed later the same day. Also, following our room being cleaned on the third day we returned to find we had not had our toilet roll replenished and our little soaps which had been originally provided had been removed!!! It was a little bit embarrasing to ask the porter for toilet roll and soap, but he arranged supply straight away!! All in all this is a great hotel which we feel represents very good value in a city which is very expensive!! P.S. we found it a little unusual that we did not have the choice of whether to have our towels replaced daily - by the third day it would have been nice to have fresh clean towels (we should say here that we did not specifically ask to have them changed).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HeyDAVEScotland
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in good quiet location. The standard double room was very well decorated and maintained. Pretty good value for Venice given how expensive the place can be!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Group”
Reviews.Author: mberkman
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at this lovely hotel with our extended family of 7 adults and 6 teenagers. The positive reviews of this hotel are well documented and don't need to be repeated here. I just wanted to let people who might be traveling with a group such as ours know that the hotel was perfect for our needs. We were quite lucky to find such a charming hotel in a quiet and picturesque neighborhood that could accommodate all of us. The most impressive part of our stay by far was the hospitality of owners Graziella and Valentina who were able to make our stay a special one. My daughter is still raving about how much fun it was to learn about Venice and the Italian people from someone who obviously enjoys a passion for life! They made us feel like we were special guests of such an enchanted city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful charming hotel, quite but close enough to everythin”
Reviews.Author: InternatNewYorks
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I traveled through Italy from July 6th to July 24th. We visited Rome, Cinque Terre, Florence, Venice and Capri We stayed three nights at the Ca' Zose. The rooms are adorable and very clean. The hotel is in a quite arear. St. Marco is 15min. away by foot. The breakfast is typical itian style (nothing special) but good. The service is excellent. My boyfriend asked me to marry him in Venice. The hotel was of great help. They gave him tips where to dine at night and provided a bottle of champagne and real rose pedals when we returned happily engaged. Btw ristorante Lineadombra is amazing. A little price but worth it. [--] They organized a night gondola ride and a guitar for my boyfriend for his proposal.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to enjoy Venice from”
Reviews.Author: p_l_c_s
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel very much. The rooms were beautifully decorated, and ours was pretty spacious. The bed was comfortable, and the room and the place in general was very clean. The shower wasnâ€™t the best, a bit small and was set up a bit strange, but it was usable and something that wouldn't have discouraged us from staying there again. The area was pretty quiet but in close range of Saint Marco and you could easily get to 2 water bus stations from the hotel making it very easy to get around the city. The staff was very nice, and all spoke good English and some of them spoke pretty good French as well. They had regional wines in the room for pretty cheap, and the white wine was pretty good, especially for the price! It was nice to sit in the room in the early evening and rest for a bit sipping the cool white wine before setting out again. Breakfast wasnâ€™t very exciting but it was enough. It wasnâ€™t a very cheap hotel, but I donâ€™t think there are many of those in Venice, especially ones this nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dkf03
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay June 30 - July 3. The hotel was just what we expected. Clean, comfortable - the staff was friendly and helpful. And the morning Caffe Latte's were a terrific start to the day. We had no problem communicating in English, which was really helpful, since our Italian is pretty pathetic. The breakfast was good and typical European. The room was a good size, and we had a nice view of the canal. The bathroom was long and narrow. And yes the shower was small. We didn't spend much time in the shower, or even in the bathroom, so it really wan't an issue. The bed was...firm. This too was OK, as it was great for our weary bodies at the end of a long day walking. The location was perfect. Nice and quiet in the evenings, yet close enough to everything we wanted. This was our first trip to Venice, and we would love to go back. We would definately stay at Locanda Ca'Zose again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTaveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a week at Locanda Ca' Zose with friends who had recommended the hotel to me and who were my traveling companions in Venice. The hotel is very well located in the quiet yet very accessible Dorsoduro area. The two owner-managers, Graziela and Valentina, and the rest of the staff could not have been more friendly and accomodating. As noted in prior reviews, the hotel is kept in an immaculate condition. The rooms are well furnished and have been recently refurbished. The air conditioning works very well. The breakfast choices are extensive. Given the very reasonable price for a room at this hotel, the Locanada Ca' Zose is a terrific value in a most expensive city. I will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for expensive city”
Reviews.Author: AVBB
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Hotel is situated in Dorsoduro area, which is quiet and pleasant - Close to San Marco via vaporetto (only one stop) - Staff are friendly - Air conditioning was functional and powerful Cons (minor): - Shower box is extremely small, even by Italian hotel standards, so very hard to move around without hitting shower box - No shelf for soap in the shower box, so inconvenient - Great TV channels... if you understand Italian - Windows were left open sometimes, letting mosquitoes in Overall, you get what you pay for in Venice - it is an expensive city, but this hotel is decent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Pleasant owners/ staff, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bintherdunthat
Reviews.Content: Stayed in April '07. Location Dorsoduro is great. Venice is crowded, Dorsoduro is up-scale and quiet, yet close to San Marco. 150 yds./m from a public uncrowded traghetto (gondola) crossing, about $1. Close to Accademia (sp) bridge. Owners were very helpful, Graziella and daughter, and cordial. Having read other reviews that called them rude, perhaps they misinterpreted their refinement and class. The owners gave us some great restaurant tips and walking tour tips. The nite staff was pleasant and hospitable. As far as reviews go regarding lack of mirrors, small shower stalls and flat pillows, we didn't notice and we can call ourselves well-travelled. When visiting Venice, realize many buildings, now hotels, were built 500+ years ago. Space was and is at a premium and people were smaller. Italians fit in standard shower stalls as do weight and height proportionate people of all nationalities. Breakfast was standard fare for Italian hotels. Europeans don't do huge eggs, bacon and pancake mornings, one reason they may fit in their showers. We hope to go back to Venice and will gladly stay at Locanda Ca' Zose.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: bromsgrovian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in June 2007. The Locanda Ca'Zose is a simple bed and breakfast establishment with character in an excellent location for sightseeing in Venice. The rooms, decorated in traditional Ventian style, are not overly spacious but are comfortable and clean with excellent bathrooms, although the shower cubicles are small and typical of this category of European hotel especially where space is at a premium - but what do people expect for this price!. It is probably not the hotel to choose for your first night on honeymoon or some other special occasion but for those who wish to see and be close to the sights of Venice at an affordable price then this is the place for you. Graziella and Valentina know their business and offer guests good value. In our view those who criticise have unreasonable expectations of a tourist hotel and should look elsewhere and expect to pay considerably more in order to satisfy their desires.

Reviews.Title: “I'd do it again (in fact, I have!)”
Reviews.Author: AustinJim
Reviews.Content: I really like Ca' Zose. It's an excellent value in a very good part of Venice (Dorsoduro) away from the huge and noisy crowds yet it's a 10 minute or so walk to San Marco. The rooms are very clean and neat and the two sisters who run the hotel are very helpful and concerned that you enjoy your stay. One of the ways you can tell if a business is a good one is by staff turnover. At Ca' Zose, the night porter has been there 4 years and the young lady who sets up breakfast has been there over 2 years. I found the breakfast similar to other places in Italy and certainly satisfying. I can remember a selection of pastries, toast, jam, cereal, fruit, yogurt and juice. I stayed in 3 other places on my trip and this was the best of them all. I also stayed there last September and liked it so much I stayed there again. I highly recommend Ca' Zose for it's value, location and attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value; No Frills”
Reviews.Author: smaudrey
Reviews.Content: We almost canceled our reservation after reading some of the reviews on Trip Advisor...and even WORSE, the managment responses to those reviews. I couldn't believe how "managment" was responding to former guest. I can't wait to read my managment response to this post. A word of advice to managment: YOU are doing more harm than good...Your responses are somewhat rude and reiterating what others have said. Whew, glad I got that over. Having said that....Venice is a VERY expensive place to stay. We booked this hotel based on value. That is what we got. Value...No frills. This was our third hotel while in Italy, the most expensvie one and at the bottom of our three. Again, Venice = Expensive. You get what you pay for. The entry is unimpressive, but who really cares about an entry. There isn't an elevator, but we are young fit people, so that didn't matter much either. The stairwell and hallways are dark and narrow, but welcome to Venice! We paid extra for the canal view, and glad we did. It gave us some extra light into the room and a lovely view. The room was clean and large enough for my husband and I. I didn't like we only had one mirror in the entire room and that was in the bathroom. While my husband was getting ready in the bathroom, I had to use a compact makeup mirror that i brought. Is an extra mirror that much? There was room on the wall over the desk, come on! The bathroom TINY. I mean TINY. The shower is almost hysterical; you can barely turn around and your arms hit the side of the shower everyime you move! But, in defense, the shower we had in Rome was the same size...So it must be an Italy thing...But the bathroom itself is still too small. If you are even a slightly larger person, book the room with a larger shower (they have one with a tub/shower). There was mold in our shower, but I just closed my eyes and hurried up. What harm can a little mold do? Right? The breakfast is just awful (the worst in our three hotels)..Toast , yogurt, and cereal. Plan to grab a bite somewhere else. OK, so if you are looking for a somewhat clean, comfy, affordable place to stay, then this is it. Expect nothing more. I would not stay here again, I will pay more for a better place....But on this trip, we were motivated by the price. Again, you get what you pay for. Oh, and mangament....My name is S. Farrington, Birmingham, Alabama. Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small inn”
Reviews.Author: Marigrace
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the end of May. We had no complaints. The "older lady" ,Grace, was very nice to us.She insisted that we take the botel's umbrellas since it was raining. Sure the showers were small but this is Europe. The hotel is spotless. We had an early train so the night before the staff setup our breakfast in our rooms. The next time we go to Venice we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent bang for the buck, great location”
Reviews.Author: MojoTheHelperMonkey
Reviews.Content: First off, the best part about this hotel -- The location is simply perfect. It's deep in the heart of Dorsoduro, close to two vaporetto stops, a 3 minute walk from the Accademia bridge and near a really quaint little canal. It's well away from the hustle and bustle of Saint Marks and makes a perfect home base for exploring all corners of Venice. (I really can't imagine staying near St Marks, I think I would have gone nuts). The remaining details of the hotel were about average. The breakfasts did the trick but weren't all that good. Two of the three women we dealt with who worked there were friendly and helpful, while the older woman was a bit rude. The night and cleaning staff were friendly. The room was cute and on the small side (to be expected at this price point) but the bed wasn't all that comfortable. The view was of nothing, but we knew going in we didn't have a canal side room. And the bad-- The pillows are absolutely terrible, some of the worts we've ever slept on. When we asked for a second set, they brought two more of the same type, so it's likely that's all they have. The worst part though was the shower stall. I'm used to tight showers in Europe, but this took the cake. It was the smallest shower bay I've ever had the displeasure of squeezing into. My elbows were constantly hitting the sides and it was just about impossible to bend down. My wife and I had constant laughs about me squeezing in each day. I'm not the biggest guy so if anyone heavy is thinking of staying here, I'd make darn sure you're getting a room with a bigger shower (if there is one). All in all, it's a decent bang for the buck in a great location, but nothing exceptional. That being said, the next time I go to Venice, I'll probably spend a bit more for something nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Locanda Ca'Zose”
Reviews.Author: sarah4nil
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Locanda Ca'Zose just last week. We had the double economy room which was quite comfortable and met our needs. The place was very clean. The location couldn't be better - it is really close to the Salute Vaporetto stop and in a nice quiet neighborhood. We took the #1 Vaporetto (which ran every 10 minutes) across the canal every day to San Marco just one stop away (we had a 72 hour pass). Incidentally the Alilaguna airport transfer is next to the San Marco stop so getting from hotel to the airport was very easy too. The breakfast consisted of a variety of small pastries/ tea cakes, cereal, toast, yogurt, juices, fruit and canned peaches. A nice girl made cappuccino for us every morning and kept the pastry shelf stocked. We felt that this place was very good value, comfortable and extremely convenient - would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nevada_Travelers
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel with extremely friendly, english speaking staff. Our room was very clean and nice and the location of the hotel was excellent. It is very close to the vaparetto stop which is very convenient and the Guggenheim art collection as well as the Acadamia art collection are steps away. I liked being a little bit removed from San Marco in a more residential neighborhood and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet ,clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: merewthr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice at this hotel and found it very quiet , convenient and clean. We had one quad room and it was very comfortable for our family of 4. The continental breakfast was great, though the breakfast room a little squishy! This hotel is located in a lovely area right near the Peggy Guggenheim art museum which is fascinating. There are some reasonably priced trattorias nearby and some interesting little shops. We would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “shabby, not chic”
Reviews.Author: BostonGoose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Ca' Zose. We are experienced european travelers and feel we have reasonable expectations, given various properties' price-points. We did not feel that this hotel was worth the cost. Let me begin with some positives: The owners and their staff are very nice and cordial. They were willing to call for us to make dinner reservations and provide us with details about taking the vaporetto in the early am.The room was spacious; and the bathroom was modern and had an adequate supply of hot water. The location is superb. It is adjacent to a canal which is constantly being photographed for its quiet, authentic beauty.However, there were some problems that would prompt me to advise readers to look elsewhere. The room was furnished in shabby, mock 17th c. venetian furniture. The sconces were of the lowest quality mock-murano glass. And two of the chairs were in need of repair, as they were about two fall apart. The hotel is laid out in two wings. As we passed from one our wing to the main section, there was always a garbage odor. Finally, breakfast was atrocious.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, comfortable and good position”
Reviews.Author: laulau_carter
Reviews.Content: Lovely owners and a good position. We went over easter school holidays so it was quite busy but service was excellent and the breakfast was great, pastries, bread, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, toast, cakes, cappuchino's etc. One of the sisters organised a tour for us and got us a discount as we are students which was fantastic. All in all and excellent stay with the only isue being that the bed was two single pushed together and my boyfriend kept falling down the middle during the course of the night but we didnt mention it as it wasnt a huge issue but in future would ask for a propper double. And there definitley will be a future , we plan on returning once we finish our degrees and would certainly stay there again. Would give everything 10 out of 10!!.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CFSurrey
Reviews.Content: We selected Ca' Zose 4-6 April after reading the Trip Advisor reviews and booked direct with the hotel. It completely lived up to the reviews with friendly and helpful staff and the room was excellent. Breakfast has a good cold buffet. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PazzaLeeds
Reviews.Content: I booked this Locanda for my girlfriend's Mum and Dad as a suprise present. They had a great time in Venice and they loved the Ca Zose - good breakfasts, really comfy beds and the hosts Graziella and Valentina couldn't have been more welcoming. I am going to return to Venice soon and I'll make sure I stay at the Ca Zose.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: HappyLittleVegemite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on March 20th - 24th 2007 Having read all the reviews on this Hotel, I took a punt and booked it. It was much better than most of the reviews told me. I expected a small room and small bathroom. What I got was a good size room and good sized bathroom. Yes, the walls are thin and you can hear through them but so what, most of the european hotels are like this. I loved this Hotel. The staff were fantastic nothing was too much trouble for them and the rooms were spotless and beautifully decorated. GREAT location right near the Salute Church and Vapretto. So easy to find, with clear and precise instructions from the hotel. We found that the shower cord was very short and to have a shower (depending on your height, my husband is 6' 1") we had to sit in the bath. We found also, again as in most european hotels, that the dining room was tiny and that a double bed was usually two singles pushed together. The stairs are narrow and there is no lift but the staff are only too happy to help you with your luggage if you need them to. Having said all that it did not dampen our experience in this hotel, we loved it and would recommend it highly. Thank you everyone at Locanda Ca'Zose for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “A well kept secret no more”
Reviews.Author: anmChicago
Reviews.Content: Locanda Ca' Zose, located between the Santa Maria della Salute church and the Peggy Guggenheim Museum, occupies a corner of a quite street in a beautiful, upscale area. The room we had was small, but beautifully furnished and sparkling clean. The beds were comfortable, and our our two windows opened onto a quiet courtyard. This hotel is an unbelievable bargain. The sisters, who own and operate the hotel, were extremely helpful with delightful personalities. Watch for Graziella's beautiful jewelry, which she makes herself. Breakfasts were excellent -- great cafe Americano!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: EJD46
Reviews.Content: This is a very special hotel run by two sisters (Valentina and Graziella) who are dedicated to making their guests feel welcome. They speak good English and are a fund of information on local transport, places to eat, attractions etc. The hotel is small, charming and spotlessly clean. It is very well located in a quiet and beatiful area, close to a Vaporetto stop (Salute) on the Grand Canal. This makes it very accessbile to other parts of the City. It is excellent value to money and I will certainly be returning there on my next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: beawallabee
Reviews.Content: Great place with an excellent relation quality/price. Good breakfast, everything is really cleaned, and a very good situation in the great area of Dorsoduro

Reviews.Title: “Charming and low-key”
Reviews.Author: ExpertTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: Lovely little inn, owned by two sisters. We spent several days here at the tail-end of summer. It could not be in a better location: Dorsoduro, away from the hoards. And, yet, it is so easy to get around. The rooms were small and clean. Bathrooms rather small, especially the shower. My heavy-set father had a difficult time in the enclosed shower stall, as he did with the stairs up to the third floor (there is no elevator). I, too, struggled DOWN the tiny stairs with all of our luggage for our 4am departure, as I was hosting my partner and parents, and my parents (mid-70s) needed help with their belongings. Both of the owners make a special effort to help you feel at home, and provide useful information about the local area. They are invaluable in recommending restaurants. Breakfast is very plain and simple. I found that I needed extra shots of caffeine early in the day and located a cafe several blocks away! You do have to walk a bit to get to a decent restaurant; alternatively, the vaporetto stop is very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel away from the crowds...”
Reviews.Author: anne068
Reviews.Content: We spent the second half of our Venice stay at Ca'Zose. It was lovely and very clean. The room felt bigger than it actually was due to the beamed and lofted ceiling. The mini bar was more than reasonable and nice to have available. Our only regret was having to pay $100 to take a watertaxi at 5am to get to the airport. They were very helpful in arranging the taxi for us, I just wish my question had been addressed when booking the reservation via email as I would have booked a hotel on the mainland the last night. It is really nice to stay away from the crowds in this quiet little area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautifully furnished, great atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: risaroo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfection for us. Close enough to easily walk to San Marco and with super-quick access to the Vaporetto, Venice is at your fingertips - BUT: you're somehow also tucked away from the madness of the tourist-throngs, and able to feel like your "Venetian home away from home" is a sancutary of sorts. Add to that the elegantly comfortable rooms and the charming atmosphere of the hotel with the friendly and genuinely helpful stuff and you have absolute perfection. There is nothing to complain about. We were there on a quick weeknd getaway passing for our honeymoon (if we could only have taken a week!) and this hotel more than fulfilled our needs for romance, relaxation, and adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: edm0n
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short stay at the Ca' Zose. Excellent hotel with friendly and informative staff and central location (one vaparrerto stop from San Marco) could not be bettered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LaWayne
Reviews.Content: Locanda Ca' Zose is a charming, cosy, delightful getaway in a beautiful city! We arrived via train and took a water taxi to the hotel. (After an half-day in Florence and two train rides, we were too tired to deal with the water bus) It cost around 55 Euro, pricey, yes, but our driver was very nice and gave a short tour and information about the city, then dropped us at the hotel. There is a landing at the side of the reception, so only dragged the luggage 5 yards! The night man at reception was very nice and when he went to take us to our room, he locked the front door which told me that there would not be anyone wondering in off the street and added to the feeling of safety. Our room was on the top floor, it took several steps and landings but we were on a floor with only two other rooms. The decor was charming and just as shown on the website. The bath room was medium in size with a shower stall and was very clean, extremely clean. The room had a desk with a mini-bar and reasonable prices. The hotel is very close to the Accademia bridge and a 15 minute brisk walk to Piazza San Marco. Breakfast was always plentiful and wonderful cappucino. Valentina ( I think ) was always at the desk ready with advice or even just a chat. Staff was very pleasant and accommodating. We ordered a water taxi to take us to the airport the night before we left and they called and confirmed the time and taxi number in the morning and chatted with us until it arrived. Water taxis are expensive, but if you can, do take at least one. It is something unlike anything else to travel by water through such a wonderfully historical city with beautiful palaces and churches at every turn. I am returning in July and have already booked the same room and cannot wait to explore the city even further!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fionaom
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a perfect location, very accessible. People were very friendly and helpful with directions. I was traveling with a group of 12 people, 6 doubles. All rooms were very clean. Would definitely recommend it. Great find!

Reviews.Title: “Suitably situated and nicely quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: WivanS
Reviews.Content: Nicely situated in the quiet Dorsoduro neighbourhood, at close distance from the Salute waterbusstop and the beautiful Chiesa Santa Maria della Salute. Also nearly on the doorstep of the Guggenheim museum and very near the Academia bridge acrross the Canal,as a passway to San Marco. Expertly run by the dedicated owners and serviced by adequate staff. The hotel is well equiped, well kept, clean and quiet. Can be recommended without any restrictions. A good address for a perfect stay in Venezia! Willem van Es, Holland

Reviews.Title: “Dreams Come True at Locanda Ca Zose”
Reviews.Author: jeznem
Reviews.Content: Locanda Ca Zose was a great choice. Located in the quiet areas of Dorosoduro, it was a stone's throw from Peggy Guggenheim collection and little rows of art galleries. By the way, if you're looking to be in the middle of the "action", then this area might be a little quiet for you (look for something in St Mark's Square), but if you're an art lover who likes a bit of peace and quiet, this is the area for you. It was everything that I had hoped for, from large majestic, victorian style rooms to great electric heating anytime (not the ancient types that rely on gas and come on at a certain time in the evening). They had a TV (also MTV and other channels), beds were very comfortable and had all the modern amenities like a hairdryer in the room, a small bar fridge. The staff were very friendly and accomodating, from Valentina who took the time to write down vaporetto schedules for me, and Grace who made me a small breakfast at 5.30 am the day I was leaving (breakfast is usually served between 8 to 10 am). The night receptionists were both very kind as well, with one of them even escorting me to find an internet kiosk that was open on Sunday (I forgot to reconfirm my 7 am flight) until 10 pm the night before! I truly appreciated the kind gestures. Nothing bad about the place at all. Restaurant, shopping suggestions from all were all perfectly suited to me. (One of them even gave me a discount and waved the coperto charges!) Certainly felt safe in this area in Venice. Only suggestion for the Locanda could be perhaps more excursion brochures could be stocked (they ran out when I was there, but no big deal since I could get around, doing sightseeing easily on my own). And maybe a small water dispenser for guests near reception will truly complete the wonderful experience. A fantastic way to wrap up my maiden trip to Europe as a single female traveller! Many thanks to everyone at Locanda Ca Zose for the wonderful stay. A dream come true!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the location”
Reviews.Author: zachgam
Reviews.Content: Location: In Dorsodoro just a short traghetto ride (50 cents) across to San Marco area or walk across Academia Bridge, five minute walk from Hotel. The Dosodoro is a quiet residential area in morning and night. Quite bustling in the afternoon. Two minute walk to Peggy Guggenheim Museum. Lots of galleries and shops of all types in a real neighborhood. Hotel: Small entrance and small breakfast room. Our room was very small and dark . Could use more lamps. The bathroom was very tiny but servicable with good water pressure. We did see rooms that seem bigger. Service: Valentina was very helpful and friendly with good suggestions. Tip: Take a water taxi. It goes right up to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: orsopixi
Reviews.Content: A great find of a place. Booked this pretty much at the last minute for it's location. It's in Dorsoduro away from the hustle and bustle of St.Marks. Very easy to find, only a five or so minute walk away from either Accademia or Salute boat stops. Nice clean rooms that have been synpathetically refurbished. It's just around the corner from the Guggenheim. Very friendly owners who gave me some great tips on where to eat,(not easy in very touristy Venice) and where to shop, (the only large supermarket nearby). Will definitely stay at Ca' Zose when I am next in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “dear little hotel away from the madding crowds”
Reviews.Author: zizzle
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice and stayed one night in the Ca Zose, after reading Trip advisor reviews. We were not disappointed! It is a little gem, recently redecorated, but with typical Venetian charm, exposed beams, and in a pretty and quiet street in the Dorsoduro area, ideally situated away from the madding crowds, but is a short walk (with only one bridge!) from Salute vaporetto. We had a double and a double superior (not much difference, superior was larger had twin beds and was higher up), both very quiet and comfortable, spotlessly clean. There is a bar fridge but no kettle. The staff were friendly and helpful and Valentina (who I presumed was one of the sister / owners mentioned in previous reviews) gave excellent dining ideas (including where NOT to eat) and made a reservation for us. Nothing was too much trouble and the front desk service was personal: as we arrived, Valentina knew exactly who we were. Continental breakfast was above expectations, served in a small but quaint little dining area. The hotel does not have any other shared guest or dining facilities but there are many cafes and restaurants only a short walk away. There are no lifts but a maid assisted my parents with their bags. I would definitely stay there again if i wanted small typically Venetian hotel accomodation in a quiet location with easy access to the Vaporettos: for Venice we thought it was also good value for money considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Ca' Zose”
Reviews.Author: madamsusan
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful way to end our 2 week trip to Italy - at Ca' Zose! The hotel is immaculately clean, delightfully staffed and nicely situated on a quiet canal in a convenient location. Valentina and Graziella do a wonderful job of making their guests feel at home and attending to their guests' needs with charm and wit. Grazie!! Susan and Don Faistl

Reviews.Title: “nice area”
Reviews.Author: AET
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week holiday to Italy and spent 3 nights at Locanda Ca Zose. We chose this hotel from the reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. We arrived and were taken to our room on the 3rd floor (no lift). The room was a good size although we had booked a double superior and to me our room was like a double we would get in Scotland, so not sure what the double would be like. The room was spotless and the bed was very comfy, the hotel is in a quite area so there was no noise at all. The bathroom was small but nice and clean, my 6f 3" boyfriend found the shower cubicle slightly small but apart from that the room was lovely. There is also a fridge. The area is great, just a minutes vaparetto ride from St Marks square. because Ca Zose is on the other side of the grand canal, we ate at some cheaper Trattoria than over near the tourist spots. The hotel is also a 10 min walk from Campo Santa Margherita where there are a few cafes/bars/restaurants which are open until late. I would definately recommend this hotel and woiuld stay here again although I'm not sure if I would like to walk around the dark streets on my own at night in this area. I felt perfectly safe with my boyfriend though.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelling_with_kids
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 teens) stayed at this lovely hotel in the beginning of August. The two sisters and staff that run the hotel are friendly and helpful. The neighbourhood is quiet at night and easily within a fifteen minute walk or a two minute traghetto ride to the noisier and more touristy San Marco. Breakfast was fine. No internet but who cares...we're in Venice!! One morning it started to rain just as we were leaving the hotel. Without asking one of the sisters kindly offered us an umbrella. Need I say more? The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms spotless. I would return without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: FreqTrav03
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The staff are very friendly, and helpful with restaurant recommendations and other advice. The room was large and clean, and although it bordered a small side street it was not too noisy because that part of the city is generally very quiet, especially at night. The Tragetto across the canal was right around the corner, but also not too far to walk to the bridge. Breakfast was relatively sparse, although the coffee was excellent. Would highly recommend La Coze to anyone staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: mountainflower
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Ca'Zose in the lovely, quiet area of Dorsoduro. The hotel is easy to miss, especially if you are a bit frayed around the edges as we were when we arrived (we travelled the day after the bomb scares at UK airports). There is no lift, so something to be aware of if you have mobility problems or lots of luggage - fortunately it wasn't a problem for us. The hotel owners were friendly and accommodating. Our room was on the second floor with a pleasant view of the small canal from the two windows. It was quite compact but very clean and nicely decorated. Some nice restaurants within 5 minutes walk - we had our one evening meal at La Rivista close to the accademia bridge. The breakfast room at Ca'Zose is very small so be prepared for a cosy breakfast with your fellow travellers! Everything that you go to Venice to see is within walking distance of the hotel if you like walking like us, or there are convenient water-bus stops nearby. Overall a very nice introduction to Venice for us on our first stay. I hope we will go back again but will probably try a different hotel next time - not because of any problems, it was lovely, but because we like to try different things.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: ecommerce_02
Reviews.Content: The Sisters at Ca Zose where very friendly and personable. Single room with private bath were elegantly decorated, clean and comfortable. Delicious cappacino and continental style breakfast each morning was a pleasant way to start the day!! Close to Wake Forest University's Casa Artom.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: annieandme
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a short stay in Hotel CaZose with my twelve year old daughter. The hotel is ABSOLUTELY delightful. So clean that you could have eaten off the bathroom floor. Ca'Zose is so ideally situated,off the main beaten track ,where it is so peaceful, yet only a two minute stop from the water buses on the Grand Canal and only one stop away from St Marks Square. We didnt want to leave and hope to go back soon.We would recommend this small, yet delightful hotel to anyone wishing to enjoy Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Count on the Ca Zose' !”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in late June at the Ca Zose'. It was the first time we trusted the reviews of other TripAdvisors to choose a hotel. (We have used other travel review sites to decide on a property or not.) Ca Zose' is convenenient (Salute stop) and quiet in the residential Dorsoduro neighborhood. As others have opinied, Valentina and Graziella truly make the hotel what it is--intimate, clean, comfortable, --a bit of a home away from home for the weary traveler. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Ca'Zose's perfect position”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having arrived in Venice after a tortuous Ryanair journey, it was such a pleasure to leave the vaporetto at the Salute stop, wander over one beautiful bridge, along one street and there was Ca'Zose. Its smart reception and welcoming staff were great. We were lead to the top floor where we had a clean, spacious room and modern, airy bathroom. Silence reigned at night and we were always only a step away from where we wanted to see the sights. Very worth looking at.

Reviews.Title: “Haven of peace in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely three night stay at Ca Zose in Venice. Graciella and Valentina, the proprietors, made us very welcome and even gave me a small birthday gift on the day of our arrival. Our large bedroom was spacious and well fitted, in the Venetian style, with a superb en suite shower room. Everywhere was immaculately clean and the air conditioning was very effective and quiet. On request, we were provided with facilities for tea making at no extra charge - something which I believe is quite unusual in Venice! The breakfast was excellent - a choice of cakes, pastries, bread, cereals, yoghurt and an ample supply of freshly made coffee. The hotel is only a few yards from the Guggenheim Museum - a very peaceful location yet only minutes from St Mark's Square - the vaporetto stop being about 5 minutes walk away. When we return to Venice, this will be our first choice of accommodation!

Reviews.Title: “cozy ca' zose”
Reviews.Author: lovecrepes
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i just spent a wonderful 6-night stay at ca' zose and were glad that we chose this reasonably priced lodging. sisters graziella and valentina were a large part of why our stay was so memorable, they are friendly, attentive, and accommodating. because i have an allergy to certain seafood and was reluctant to eat fish anywhere in venice, valentina spoke with the owners of trattoria sempione in the non-touristy section of san marco and got assurance that there would be no chance of cross-contamination. so i was able to sample traditional venetian cuisine without fear of a trip to l'ospidale! each morning we had excellent caffe latte or cappuccino, creamy yogurts, and assorted italian pastries. unfortunately fresh fruit was not offered, but it would make a welcome addition to their bountiful breakfast buffet. we stayed in a small twin-bedded double superior room on the 3rd floor overlooking the street. the one canal-view room i saw had more space and light. because venice is on a lagoon, mosquitos can be a problem. pack repellent or keep the windows closed and use the air conditioning. this dorsoduro neighborhood was perfect for us since the highlights of our stay were visits to the peggy guggenheim museum, ca' rezzonico, the 18th century palazzo, the accademia galleries, and pinault's contemporary art exhibit at palazzo grassi. all are minutes from the locanda. we also enjoyed a vivaldi concert at a nearby church. if you tire of dining out, billa supermarket, which is not far away, carries everything you would need for a picnic. i can't wait to return to beautiful venice and ca' zose.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable central hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have frequently visited the Ca'Zose hotel since it was opened in 2003. Everytime we felt like coming home. The hotel is located in Dorsoduro, close to the Salute church and the Peggy Guggenheim Museum. This location is beautiful as well as central: Just one vaporetto stop to the Marcus Place. The two elegant, vivid sisters who are running the hotel are taking very good care of their visitors, helping with questions and providing a great service. The hotel is a unique, family-friendly place with beautiful interior, far from a standard place to sleep. We can highly recommend the Ca'Zose hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Venice at its best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you look for a lovely, individual, central, friendly place in Venice, treat yourself with a visit at the Ca'Zose hotel. It is a delightful place in Dorsoduro and our favorite hotel in all of Venice! Extraordinary service, lovely Italian owners, beautiful interior, great location close to all the important sights.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this Hotel a lot”
Reviews.Author: riffs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first trip to Italy on recommendations I found on Tripadvisor. We were two couples sharing a quad room. It was a bit small for 4 adults but quite adequate. We all really liked this reasonably priced hotel. The breakfasts were very good, the sisters who run the place are very nice as is the rest of the staff. The location I thought was the best as you are close to everything but not smack dab in the middle of all the hub bub. We would all stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Good for family too...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a real gem - perfectly located just a single waterbus stop from the heart of Venice but situated in a quiet street amid interesting art shops. The family suite had plenty of space for the 2 of us & our young kids. And it was definitely well kept & clean. Breakfast was a tasty start to the day, with a variety of pastries, bread, yogurt, and cold cereals. No fruit though, which was a minor downside. The staff were very friendly & helpful in giving info & advice, and I think they spoke at least 3 or 4 languages. All in all - a most pleasant place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a lovely little place”
Reviews.Author: gottagetgoing
Reviews.Content: Ca'Zose is very well-priced for Venice, and provided a much higher level of service, decor, and comfort than similarly priced hotels in the city. Our room was very spacious, decorated in a Venetian style without being too gawdy, nice Murano glass lighting, spotless modern bathroom with bidet. Valentina was helpful, spoke what appeared to be fluent French, English, and Italian, and provided a personalized level of attention uncommon for this price-range. The Dorsoduro neighborhood is the best: Convenient 10 minute walk from many "main" attractions, but quiet and less touristed than the hotels and restaurants elsewhere. Take the gondola across the Grande Canale toward San Marco for only 50cents for a cheap treat - one place to do this is near the hotel walking toward Salute (ask at Ca'Zose). I would highly recommend Ca'Zose, and plan to return as soon as I can!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, not too bad location”
Reviews.Author: rgamfin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice but a little difficult to locate initially. There was also construction outside but it wasn't a major problem. We enjoyed our room and found the service to be great. The only negative I must report (other than the location) was the mosquitos and the very hot room. Because the weather outside was cold, there didn't seem to be a way to cool down the room except for opening the windows. Unfortunately opening the windows let in a couple mosquitos (the hotel supplied mosquito spray). It wasn't a big deal but it was a little annoying that the room was always so hot (mostly because the heated towel rack in the bathroom was radiating heat throughout the room). Other than that, the rooms are very nice and just a little different than the usual. The beds were the best part of the room, in all of our hotel stays in Italy we enjoyed these beds/pillows the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent two nights here, warm room, excellent bathroom - no toliet roll holder though! The rooms seemed to have a real personal touch in their decor. While we were staying there were 'roadworks' going on to the canal but the repairs should be finished by now and will keep the canal good for another hundred years before the next set of works!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, out-of-the-way hotel”
Reviews.Author: PRV
Reviews.Content: We paid 120e per night for our room. The owners are really helpful. Bedrooms are roomy and clean, nice sparkly bathrooms. The hotel is a corner building and there are lots of building works to the pavement going on at the moment [we were woken at 7am yesterday by the workmen]. My only criticism of the Ca'Zose is that there is no lounge, or anywhere to sit and read and have a coffee in comfort if the other half wants to put their head down for an hour, for example, although it would be fair to say reasonably-priced italian hotels with decent public rooms are thin on the ground, at least in my experience. We went with people from our italian night-school class, some of whom indicated that they wouldn't be happy with a bargain basement option, which is why I went for the Ca'Zose. If you want to stay in a sleepy, tidy, warm and clean place close to the Salute and Zattere you'll do well to stay here. If you want more "life", and to be closer to Piazzale Roma, I'd choose somewhere like the Albergo Marin and save myself 50e per night. Hope this is helpful. Paul

Reviews.Title: “My Six Year Old Daughter from the USA Wants to Move to Venice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a single parent and graduate Ph.D. student traveling with my 6 year old daughter in Italy, France, and England for the first time....Locanda Ca' Zose made ALL the difference! The hotel was close to everything you want to see...Salute and the Peggy Guggenheim Collection (my daughter took part in free art activites during the afternoons at the museum), but far away from all the noise. Valentina and her sister tranformed their hotel into a true "home" for me and my daughter. In fact, my daughter asked if we could move to Venice after I complete my studies, so she could stay at Locanda Ca' Zose...not a bad idea. Locanda Ca' Zose, is truly a home away from home or better yet your second home. Enjoy!

HotelInfo.Name: Locanda Ca Zose
HotelInfo.Address: Dorsoduro 193/b | Calle del Bastion angolo Fondamenta Ca Bala, 30123 Venice, Italy
